Name: Glaciar Marconi
Description: The Marconi Glacier lies in the Los Glaciares area around El Chalten and Fitz Roy. Unsurprisingly, there are many glaciers to be found here... This is one of the most difficult to visit, however, because of the physical and technical intensity of hiking to it - a guide is needed to access it, and also to climb up it. How to see it: Trekking Trekking a thousand metres up the glacier brings you to the Marconi Pass , which is one of only three passes onto the South Patagonian Ice Field. The trek is demanding and should only really be attempted if you’re used to challenging hikes on difficult terrain, but the truly spectacular views over the ice cap from the top make the climb worthwhile. Check out other Patagonian mountaineering opportunities and ice cap expeditions onto the Patagonian ice shelf. More Details >>

Name: Glaciar Martial
Description: Glaciar Martial lies just a few kilometres away from the city of Ushuaia, and can be reached by trekking, in contrast to most glaciers in this area which can only by accessed by boat. The glacier is 1,050 metres above sea level, affording some great views for those who climb up to it, and it is possible to undertake ice-hiking on the glacier. In the winter, a ski resort opens here, and there is a chairlift to make the ascent easier.

Name: Glaciar Mayo
Description: This glacier is found in the most narrow part of the Southern Patagonian Icefield and can be seen by cruising from Lago Argentino.
Description (with html): This glacier is found in the most narrow part of the Southern Patagonian Icefield and can be seen by cruising from Lago Argentino.

Name: Glaciar O'Higgins
Description: About the Glacier: Known as the Great Glacier , Galciar O'Higgins is one of the largest in the Southern Hemisphere. This truly spectacular glacier is part of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, coming down into the remote Chilean Patagonian area of Aisen - home to the legendary Carretera Austral highway How to see it: Road Trip Glaciar O'Higgins is part of the natural roadblock that arises at the village of Villa O'Higgins, marking the terminus of the Carretera Austral - a highway that makes up the spine of Chile, connecting the isolated communities in the Patagonian wilderness to the developed north of the country. Boat Once at Villa O'Higgins, you'll have to take a boat out onto Lago O'Higgins, touring the various glaciers that feed into it. From the boat, you can either reurn to Villa O'Higgins to continue northwards or stay at a nearby luxury lodge; or cross into Argentinean Patagonia, heading towards Lago del Desierto's Aguas Arriba Lodge and the hiking community of El Chalten. More Details >>
Description (with html):
About the Glacier:

  • Known as the Great Glacier, Galciar O'Higgins is one of the largest in the Southern Hemisphere.
  • This truly spectacular glacier is part of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, coming down into the remote Chilean Patagonian area of Aisen - home to the legendary Carretera Austral highway

How to see it:

Road Trip

Glaciar O'Higgins is part of the natural roadblock that arises at the village of Villa O'Higgins, marking the terminus of the Carretera Austral - a highway that makes up the spine of Chile, connecting the isolated communities in the Patagonian wilderness to the developed north of the country.

Boat

Once at Villa O'Higgins, you'll have to take a boat out onto Lago O'Higgins, touring the various glaciers that feed into it.  From the boat, you can either reurn to Villa O'Higgins to continue northwards or stay at a nearby luxury lodge; or cross into Argentinean Patagonia, heading towards Lago del Desierto's Aguas Arriba Lodge and the hiking community of El Chalten.

More Details >>

Name: Glaciar Piedras Blancas
Description: Glaciar Piedras Blancas is in the Los Glaciares National Park and is sometimes referred to as Glaciar Fitz Roy Este. It is a highly popular viewpoint when trekking this region. How to see it: Hiking It is possible to do a day’s hike taking in both this glacier and the nearby Laguna de Los Tres. The laguna is probably the most famous and most popular viewpoint for Mt. Fitz Roy, and as it is a relatively easy hike up to the laguna, do not expect any solitude. The view is magnificent, including "Los Tres", the three peaks that you can see from the laguna's shore: Fitz Roy (3,405m), Poincenot (3,002m), and Saint-Exupéry (2,558m).

Name: Glaciar San Rafael
Description: This impressive glacier is found in the pristine Aysen region of southern Patagonian Chile. It is one of the major outlet glaciers of the Northern Patagonian Ice Field and calves into the Laguna San Rafael, within the national park of the same name. The glacier itself is stunning and sailing amongst the huge icebergs on the lake is a thrilling experience. Find out more about visiting Aysen or seeing this glacier on an adventure cruise in Patagonia >>.

Name: Glaciar Torre
Description: About the Glacier Torre Glacier is a reasonably accessible glacier, which is popular with ice hikers. Below the glacier you'll find Laguna Torre which gives you stunning views of the Los Glaciares National Park. At 3,102 metres, Cerro Torre stands above the glacier which, like many other glaciers in the national park, comes down off the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap. How to see it: Trekking Located so close to Cerro Torre, the trekking landmark of Los Glaciares along with Mt. FitzRoy, anyone hiking in the area should definitely make their way to Torre Glacier and its lagoon. More Details >>

About the Glacier

  • Below the glacier you'll find Laguna Torre which gives you stunning views of the Los Glaciares National Park.
  • At 3,102 metres, Cerro Torre stands above the glacier which, like many other glaciers in the national park, comes down off the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap.

How to see it:

Trekking

Located so close to Cerro Torre, the trekking landmark of Los Glaciares along with Mt. FitzRoy, anyone hiking in the area should definitely make their way to Torre Glacier and its lagoon.

Name: Glaciar Tyndall
Description: Part of Patagonia's most popular national park - Torres del Paine - Glaciar Tyndall is fed by the South Patagonian Ice Cap - one of the largest sub-polar masses of ice in the world. It sits adjacent to Glaciar Zapata and feeds into Glaciar Geike and Lago Tyndall. How to see it: Kayaking Kayakers can see the Tyndall glacier by paddling along the Rio Serrano from the south of Torres del Paine and camping nearby on the river bank.Find out more about kayaking in Torres del Paine and kayaking to glaciers.
Description (with html):
• Part of Patagonia's most popular national park - Torres del Paine - Glaciar Tyndall is fed by the South Patagonian Ice Cap - one of the largest sub-polar masses of ice in the world.

How to see it:

Kayaking

Kayakers can see the Tyndall glacier by paddling along the Rio Serrano from the south of Torres del Paine and camping nearby on the river bank.

Name: Glaciar Viedma
Description: Glaciar Viedma is a gigantic glacier flowing into the western end of Lake Viedma that exists primarily due to the ice that calves off the glacier and melts into the lake. The width of the glacier that touches the lake is about 1.2 miles and stretches back to the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap for many miles. How to see it Ice Trekking and Climbing Ice trekking and ice climbing are both possible on the glacier, which is accessible by a bus and boat trip from El Chalten - a hikers' haven nestled amid the mountains of Los Glaciares National Park.Find out more about ice-hiking on glaciers and mountaineering in Patagonia.
Description (with html):
Glaciar Viedma is a gigantic glacier flowing into the western end of Lake Viedma that exists primarily due to the ice that calves off the glacier and melts into the lake. The width of the glacier that touches the lake is about 1.2 miles and stretches back to the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap for many miles.

How to see it

Ice Trekking and Climbing

Ice trekking and ice climbing are both possible on the glacier, which is accessible by a bus and boat trip from El Chalten - a hikers' haven nestled amid the mountains of Los Glaciares National Park.

Find out more about ice-hiking on glaciers and mountaineering in Patagonia.

Name: Glaciar Zapata
Description: This beautiful glacier can be reached with some off-the-beaten-track trekking in Torres del Paine National Park. It is fed by the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap and is found at the top of the Pingo Valley in the south west of the park.
Description (with html): This beautiful glacier can be reached with some off-the-beaten-track trekking in Torres del Paine National Park. It is fed by the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap and is found at the top of the Pingo Valley in the south west of the park.

Name: Glacier Cagliero
Description: Glacier Cagliero is located in the Reserva Los Huemules in Argentina. Few people make it here, but there is an opportunity for ice trekking on the glacier for those that do. The Refugio Peusto Cagliero is located nearby.
Description (with html): Glacier Cagliero is located in the Reserva Los Huemules in Argentina. Few people make it here, but there is an opportunity for ice trekking on the glacier for those that do. The Refugio Peusto Cagliero is located nearby.

Name: Glacier Grey
Description: Where to find it Torres del Paine National Park, Chile What is it? The Grey Glacier is one of Torres del Paine's most spectacular glaciers, and tumbles into the serene Lago Grey. The Grey Glacier is part of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, and at its peak is 30 metres high, and around six kilometres wide. How can I see it? Trekking Torres del Paine has two classic multi-day hikes, the Full Circuit and the W Trek, both of which have awe-inspiring views of the lake and the glacier. Arguably the best view comes from during the Full Circuit hike, where trekkers can view the glacier from above as they cross the famous John Garner Pass. The W Trek's western leg takes you along its eastern shore of Lago Grey all the way up to the glacier itself. You can also hike up around the lake on a day hike, returning to a comfortable base in the evening. Boat excursion Those looking for a less demanding view can take a boat trip from the southern shore right up to the glacier. Ice-hiking No experience is necessary to don crampons, grab an ice axe and get out onto the glacier. If you relish an adventure and have never before walked over the top of a glacier, this is a fantastic place to start.After her expedition onto the ice, Swoop's Harriet maintains that 'everyone should add ice hiking onto a trek in Torres del Paine!'. You can read Harriet's Review here. Kayaking Paddle amongst the lake's sculpted icebergs, so close you can reach out and touch them. Find out more about... Torres del Paine National Park Glaciers in Patagonia Hiking in Torres del Paine
Description (with html):
Where to find it

Torres del Paine National Park, Chile

What is it?

The Grey Glacier is one of Torres del Paine's most spectacular glaciers, and tumbles into the serene Lago Grey. The Grey Glacier is part of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, and at its peak is 30 metres high, and around six kilometres wide.

How can I see it?

Trekking

Torres del Paine has two classic multi-day hikes, the Full Circuit and the W Trek, both of which have awe-inspiring views of the lake and the glacier. Arguably the best view comes from during the Full Circuit hike, where trekkers can view the glacier from above as they cross the famous John Garner Pass. The W Trek's western leg takes you along its eastern shore of Lago Grey all the way up to the glacier itself. You can also hike up around the lake on a day hike, returning to a comfortable base in the evening.

Boat excursion

Those looking for a less demanding view can take a boat trip from the southern shore right up to the glacier. 

Ice-hiking

No experience is necessary to don crampons, grab an ice axe and get out onto the glacier. If you relish an adventure and have never before walked over the top of a glacier, this is a fantastic place to start.

After her expedition onto the ice, Swoop's Harriet maintains that 'everyone should add ice hiking onto a trek in Torres del Paine!'. You can read Harriet's Review here.

Kayaking

Paddle amongst the lake's sculpted icebergs, so close you can reach out and touch them.

Find out more about... 

  • Torres del Paine National Park
  • Glaciers in Patagonia
  • Hiking in Torres del Paine

Description: Located on the Ruta 40, it is a small town in the Santa Cruz province in Argentina.

Name: Golfo San José
Description: This huge protected gulf on the western side of Peninsula Valdes is a fantastic place for kayaking in the region as the relatively sheltered waters make it a haven for wildlife. In particular colonies of sea lions live here as well as Southern Right Whales who come here to breed and calve in the summer months.

In particular colonies of sea lions live here as well as Southern Right Whales who come here to breed and calve in the summer months.

Name: Green Baker Lodge
Description: Green Baker Lodge is made up of seven comfortable cabins, all with views of the Baker River. The river is the main attraction of this lodge, being one of the best places to fish rainbow trout. As well as fly fishing, hiking, mountain biking and vehicle-based excursions are possible in the area around the lodge.

Name: Gualjaina
Description: A desert town in the rural Chubut province of Northern Patagonia, Gualjaina is the closest small town to The Piedra Parada. It is located about 40 kilometers from the famous rock formation and 65 kilometers off of the renowned Ruta 40.
Description (with html): A desert town in the rural Chubut province of Northern Patagonia, Gualjaina is the closest small town to The Piedra Parada. It is located about 40 kilometers from the famous rock formation and 65 kilometers off of the renowned Ruta 40.

Name: Guatín
Description: Guatín, also known as the Valley of the Cactus (Valle de los Cactus), is a canyon located near San Pedro de Atacama, Chile, where the Puritama and Purifica rivers converge, creating a unique ecosystem that supports a massive population of towering Candelaria cacti, some reaching over seven meters high. It's a popular spot for hiking and exploring the striking desert landscape.
Description (with html): Guatín, also known as the Valley of the Cactus (Valle de los Cactus), is a canyon located near San Pedro de Atacama, Chile, where the Puritama and Purifica rivers converge, creating a unique ecosystem that supports a massive population of towering Candelaria cacti, some reaching over seven meters high. It's a popular spot for hiking and exploring the striking desert landscape.

Name: Hacienda Tres Lagos
Description: This is a luxurious lodge offering comfortable rooms and excellent service. The surrounding lakes - General Carrera, Bertrand and Negro - make for a beautiful backdrop to trekking and horseriding, and also give you the opportunity for boat trips and fly fishing.
Description (with html): This is a luxurious lodge offering comfortable rooms and excellent service. The surrounding lakes - General Carrera, Bertrand and Negro - make for a beautiful backdrop to trekking and horseriding, and also give you the opportunity for boat trips and fly fishing.
NEW CUSTOM ADDRESS/WHAT3WORDS: Carretera Austral Km 274, Cruce El Maiten, Chile Chico, Chile.

Name: Halcón Lagoon
Description: The Halcón Lagoon is located in the Valley of the Lagoons in Tierra del Fuego. Other lagoons in this valley include Chiming Lagoon and Matamico Lagoon.
Description (with html): The Halcón Lagoon is located in the Valley of the Lagoons in Tierra del Fuego. Other lagoons in this valley include Chiming Lagoon and Matamico Lagoon.

Name: Haras de Pirque Vineyard
Description: One of Chile's Famous Vineyards. On these foothills, between 1992 and 1993, one hundred and twenty hectares of vineyards were planted, mainly with the reds Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Carmenère, and the whites Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc. Haras de Pirque's name honors the country´s oldest thoroughbred breeding stud, founded in 1892.

Name: Hidden Glaciers viewpoint
Description: The Hidden Glaciers viewpoint is at the south of Lake Frías. From here you can see Gorra, Frías, Grande and Dickson glaciers.
Description (with html): The Hidden Glaciers viewpoint is at the south of Lake Frías. From here you can see Gorra, Frías, Grande and Dickson glaciers.

Name: Hornopiren
Description: Hornopiren meaning 'snow-oven', is a wide, cone-shaped mountain and active volcano in the Los Lagos region in Chilean Patagonia. The last eruption was said to have taken place in 1835 although there are no first hand accounts about this occurence. The volcano and its small town are a growing hiking destination due to the spectacular beauty of the snow covered mountain. To find out how you can visit, see our Patagonia Chile page.

Name: Hostal Amerindia
Description: This lovely quaint B&B in Puerto Natales is a great place to stay before your trek in Torres del Paine. With authentic decor, wood stoves lit in each comunal area, comfy beds and a hearty breakfast, this newly renovated hotel offers a great place to stay at reasonable rates. No bedroom is the same which gives the place its character and charm. View this hotel and more on our Hotels in Puerto Natales page.

Name: Hostería Balmaceda
Description: Hostería Balmaceda is located at the mouth of the Serrano River, where it empties in Last Hope Sound. There are views of Glacier Serrano and Mt Balmaceda from here.
Description (with html): Hostería Balmaceda is located at the mouth of the Serrano River, where it empties in Last Hope Sound. There are views of Glacier Serrano and Mt Balmaceda from here.

Name: Hosteria Cabanas del Paine
Description: Hotel Cabanas del Paine provides comfortable accommodation at the southern border of Torres del Paine National Park beside Rio Serrano. The hotel's restaurant serves local food and Chilean wine, as well as more elaborate dishes, and there is also a traditional 'quincho' grill. In addition, there is an outdoor hot tub with views of the park.

Name: Hosteria el Paraiso
Description: Hosteria El Paraiso is one of the most popular and friendly places to stay in El Chalten. With a cosy wood burning stove in the dining room, wooden beams and comfortable but basic rooms, you can't fault it. Food is filling, with a continental breakfast in the morning and friendly staff to give you any advice. They also offer a laundry service if you need some clean clothes for your hike! Find out more and see other hotels in El Chalten.

Name: Hosteria Lago Tyndall
Description: Hosteria Lago Tyndall lies beside Rio Serrano on the southern edge of Torres del Paine National Park. The hotel has ensuite rooms and a restaurant with terrace, serving Chilean food and wine. Self-catered cabins for 4 or 6 people are also available.
Description (with html): Hosteria Lago Tyndall lies beside Rio Serrano on the southern edge of Torres del Paine National Park. The hotel has ensuite rooms and a restaurant with terrace, serving Chilean food and wine. Self-catered cabins for 4 or 6 people are also available.

Name: Hotel Arakur
Description: This hotel is set high up in the mountains above Ushuaia with unrivalled views of the surrounding channels and jagged peaks. You can hike straight from your hotel deep into the wild mountains of Tierra del Fuego to gain incredible views down onto the Beagle Channel and surrounding peaks. Alternatively, enjoy the spa facilities that the hotel has on offer whilst soaking in the stunning views. Find more information on our hotel page >>

Name: Hotel Explora Patagonia (Salto Chico)
Description: This fantastic lodge/hotel has a privileged location next to the Salto Chico waterfall , in the heart of the Torres del Paine National Park. The exclusive service offered by Explora includes a wide range of easy to difficult hikes in the park, to the Towers, Valle Frances and Valle Pingo, amongst others. The hotel also offers exciting half-day and full day rides with Chilean gauchos starting out from its beautifully cared for stables. The hotel's rooms all have views of either the Salto Chico or the impressive curly Cuernos peaks and the hotel also boasts a spa and swimming pool, 3-course meals and an open bar. What more could you ask for? >> More info about Explora Patagonia. >> See more hotels in Torres del Paine.

Name: Hotel Lago Grey
Description: Hotel Lago Grey lies on the edge of the lake from which it takes its name, within Torres del Paine National Park. This is a comfortable base from which to visit Glaciar Grey or sail on Lago Grey, both of which can be seen from superior rooms. There are several trekking opportunities nearby and the hotel offers various excursions.

Name: Hotel Las Torres
Description: Close to the entrance to the Valle Ascencio, the comfortable Hotel Las Torres is in sight of the Paine Massif. The hotel lies on the route of the popular W Trek, and is not far from the Torres del Paine Lookout. Accommodation ranges from small cosy rooms to spacious suites complete with jacuzzi and view of the mountains. The hotel offers all inclusive packages with programs including trekking and horse riding. >> Read more and check availability for Hosteria Las Torres

Name: Huilo Huilo
Description: This mystical biological reserve is located in the Chilean Lake District. For unique accommodation, you can spend a night in one of the luxury treehouses here, near some of the reserve's many waterfalls.
Description (with html): This mystical biological reserve is located in the Chilean Lake District. For unique accommodation, you can spend a night in one of the luxury treehouses here, near some of the reserve's many waterfalls.

Name: Iguazú Falls (Argentina)
Description: This incredible waterfall is 2.7km (1.7 miles) wide and is found at the border of Argentina with Brazil. A visit here is a great way to start any tour of Argentina and Patagonia, after leaving Buenos Aires.
Description (with html): This incredible waterfall is 2.7km (1.7 miles) wide and is found at the border of Argentina with Brazil. A visit here is a great way to start any tour of Argentina and Patagonia, after leaving Buenos Aires.

Name: Isla Bridges
Description: A set of four islands, located no more than 20 km from Ushuaia. They form a natural harbour offering shelter from the strong winds characteristic of the Beagle Channel. For this region the islands are popular for diving and kayaking. The islands get their name from the local Bridges family, who helped the Argentinian government colonise the area and lived peacfully amongst the native Yaghana people in their Estancia Harberton. The islands have the biggest 'concheros' in the region, which are circular shell deposits created by the Yaghana people after eating lots of seafood. To find out more about the Estancia and the Beagle Channel visit our Ushuaia page.

Name: Isla Corazon
Description: This heart shaped island is found in the middle of the Mascardi Lake in Nahuel Huapi National Park in the Bariloche region of Argentinian Patagonia. The lake itself stretches some 14 by 3 miles with many branches forming from the lake. It's here that many kayaking trips start out and follow a route around the heart shaped island. To visit this island and to find out more about all the adventures on offer in this region, see Bariloche.Also find out about Kayaking in the Lake District >>

Name: Isla de los Muertos
Description: Literally translated as the "Island of the Dead", the inhabitants of Tortel have left this island steeped in mystery after burying thirty-three people here almost one-hundred years ago. The cause of their deaths remains unknown, but their crosses remain and provide a certain eeriness to an otherwise beautiful scene at the delta of one of Chile's most important rivers, the Baker.

Name: Isla Jéchica
Description: Found in the Aisen region, this island is a natural sanctuary for flora and fauna and is pretty much untouched.
Description (with html): Found in the Aisen region, this island is a natural sanctuary for flora and fauna and is pretty much untouched.

Name: Isla Martillo
Description: Isla Martillo, or Maritllo Island, is a small island home to a penguin colony in the Beagle Channel in Tierra del Fuego. This island, along with Gable Island, belongs to the nearby Estancia Harberton, and were bequeathed to the Bridges family that lives there thanks to their extensive work with the Yaghan natives from Tierra del Fuego and as a reward for helping the Argentinian government to colonise this area. On Isla Martillo you can walk amongst the penguins and take some brilliant photos by going on a guided boat tour.

Name: Isla Santa Ines
Description: Santa Ines Island is one of the largest islands in this region. Here you can find the Grandes Ventisqueros glacier.
Description (with html): Santa Ines Island is one of the largest islands in this region. Here you can find the Grandes Ventisqueros glacier.

Name: Islote Barrientos
Description: Islote Barrientos is located in Chile and is home to one of the largest bird colonies in the country. Kelp gulls, rock shags, red-legged shags and imperial shags as well as South American fur seals can all be seen here.
Description (with html): Islote Barrientos is located in Chile and is home to one of the largest bird colonies in the country. Kelp gulls, rock shags, red-legged shags and imperial shags as well as South American fur seals can all be seen here.

Name: Islote Conejos
Description: Islote Conejos is located in the Queilen Channel on the east coast of Chiloé Island. There is a colony of Magellanic penguins on the island.
Description (with html): Islote Conejos is located in the Queilen Channel on the east coast of Chiloé Island. There is a colony of Magellanic penguins on the island.

Name: Jorge Newbery Airport, Buenos Aires (AEP)
Description: Jorge Newbery (AEP) airport is the domestic airport in Buenos Aires. International flights come into the oher main airport in Buenos Aires, Ezeiza (EZE), so you'll need to travel between the two if you're flying into Patagonia via Buenos Aires. Here you can find out more about the airports in Buenos Aires.

Description: Located in the small town of Puerto Natales near to Torres del Paine National Park, this new hotel is right on the edge of Last Hope Sound, the beautiful fjord on which Puerto Natales lies. Name: La Junta
Description: 250 km north of Coyhaique, La Junta lies near the confluence of the Rio Rosselot and Rio Palena. A sizeable settlement of over 1,200 people, you'll be able to find necessities for your roadtrip here, such as a petrol station, a supermarket, a mechanic, and access to the internet. You may have trouble finding an ATM, however.

Name: La Rosada outpost
Description: La Rosada outpost is in an isolated location near to the Chilean border. It's used as an overnight stop between Estancia Nibepo Aike and the Puesto Laguna 3 de Abril outpost.
Description (with html): La Rosada outpost is in an isolated location near to the Chilean border. It's used as an overnight stop between Estancia Nibepo Aike and the Puesto Laguna 3 de Abril outpost.

Name: Lago Brush
Description: Lago Brush or Brush Lake is a pretty lake close to the Rio Serrano in Torres del Paine National Park. The lake is a popular spot for camping out under the stars and is often visited by people on horse back. Having said that, this part of the famous Chilean park is far quieter with fewer people than on the W Circuit and Full Circuit tracks. Find out more about visiting Torres del Paine.

Name: Lago Calafquen
Description: Lago Calafquén is a beautiful glacial lake in the Chilean Lake District, straddling the border between the La Araucanía and Los Ríos regions, and is a popular summer destination known for its beaches and water sports with the Villarrica Volcano as a stunning backdrop.

Name: Lago Cholila
Description: The town of Cholila is just a few miles to the east of this lake. This is where Butch Cassidy and the Sundance kid allegedly set themselves up as cattle breeders in the early 20th century before a final bank raid in Rio Gallegos.
Description (with html): The town of Cholila is just a few miles to the east of this lake. This is where Butch Cassidy and the Sundance kid allegedly set themselves up as cattle breeders in the early 20th century before a final bank raid in Rio Gallegos.

Name: Lago Correntoso
Description: Lago Correntoso is a beautiful lake located in Nahuel Huapi National Park, near the town of Villa La Angostura in Neuquén Province, Argentina, known for its stunning turquoise waters and for being connected to Lake Nahuel Huapi by the famous and very short Correntoso River

Description: Lago Cucao is on the western side of the island of Chiloé in the Chiloé National Park.
Description (with html): Lago Cucao is on the western side of the island of Chiloé in the Chiloé National Park.

Name: Lago Curruhue
Description: An Argentinian lake close the border with Chile; Lago Currhuhue Grande and to the east Lago Curruhue Chico.
Description (with html): An Argentinian lake close the border with Chile; Lago Currhuhue Grande and to the east Lago Curruhue Chico.

Name: Lago del Desierto
Description: This stunning lake is found in Los Glaciares National Park and is usually reached in around 90 minutes via the road north of El Chalten, a popular climbers town established in 1985. The view from Lago del Desierto is really beautiful and gives another perspective of the park's famous granite peak, Cerro FitzRoy, which was first noted on 2nd March 1877 by Perito Moreno. He named it in hour of Robert FitzRoy who chartered large parts of the Patagonian coast. Lago del Desierto is a particularly good spot for seeing Patagonia's native flora and fauna, including the red-headed Magellanic woodpecker and the pan del indio, a bright orange fungus. Find out more about visiting El Chalten and Los Glaciares National Park >>

Name: Lago del Toro
Description: Lago del Toro is the largest lake in the Torres del Paine National Park and many visitors to the national park drive along its shore as they first catch sight of the famous Towers and the 'Cuernos'. The Rio Serrano flows from the north west corner of the lake. Also in the north west corner of the lake lies the park administration centre; CONAF are based here and you will also find the road leading to Camping Serrano, a lovely campsite at the edge of the Rio Serrano, which is one of the lesser known places in the park and a fantastic spot for relaxing, fishing and kayaking south into the wilderness.
Description (with html):
Lago del Toro is the largest lake in the Torres del Paine National Park and many visitors to the national park drive along its shore as they first catch sight of the famous Towers and the 'Cuernos'. The Rio Serrano flows from the north west corner of the lake.

↵

Also in the north west corner of the lake lies the park administration centre; CONAF are based here and you will also find the road leading to Camping Serrano, a lovely campsite at the edge of the Rio Serrano, which is one of the lesser known places in the park and a fantastic spot for relaxing, fishing and kayaking south into the wilderness.

Name: Lago Electrico
Description: Lago Electrico lies about 10km north of Mount Fitz Roy, as the crow flies. It is filled by the meltwater of the Marconi Glacier on the eastern edge of the South Patagonian Ice Cap.On its western edge lies La Playita, campsite with no services other than a few piles of rocks to provide some shelter from the wind, which is normally used en route to the Ice CapTo get there you normally start out from the bridge on the Rio Electrico (around 20 mins drive north of El Chalten) and hike through woodland along the banks of the river to Piedra del Fraile. The hike from Piedra del Fraile to La Playita is more challenging but has a clearly marked path.From the Electrico lake and river there are a couple of side-hikes worth exploring: the Pollone Valley and Piedra Negra. Both of these are best tackled with a guide.
Description (with html):
Lago Electrico lies about 10km north of Mount Fitz Roy, as the crow flies. It is filled by the meltwater of the Marconi Glacier on the eastern edge of the South Patagonian Ice Cap.

On its western edge lies La Playita, campsite with no services other than a few piles of rocks to provide some shelter from the wind, which is normally used en route to the Ice Cap

To get there you normally start out from the bridge on the Rio Electrico (around 20 mins drive north of El Chalten) and hike through woodland along the banks of the river to Piedra del Fraile. The hike from Piedra del Fraile to La Playita is more challenging but has a clearly marked path.

From the Electrico lake and river there are a couple of side-hikes worth exploring: the Pollone Valley and Piedra Negra. Both of these are best tackled with a guide.

Name: Lago Escondido
Description: Lago Escondido is located close to the Garibaldi Pass and is a popular place for kayaking.
Description (with html): Lago Escondido is located close to the Garibaldi Pass and is a popular place for kayaking.

Name: Lago Fagnano
Description: Located 62 miles north of the Patagonian town of Ushuaia, this glacial-formed lake is one of the largest in the world and is split between Chile and Argentina. The lake offers over 72 miles of beach to enjoy and is a great place for trekking, fishing and seeing a bit of Tierra del Fuego by boat.
Description (with html): Located 62 miles north of the Patagonian town of Ushuaia, this glacial-formed lake is one of the largest in the world and is split between Chile and Argentina. The lake offers over 72 miles of beach to enjoy and is a great place for trekking, fishing and seeing a bit of Tierra del Fuego by boat.

Name: Lago Falkner
Description: Lago Falkner (Lago Filo Hua Hum) is located in the Nahuel Napi National Park. Around it's shores are many forest trails and gravel roads, popular for mountain biking.
Description (with html): Lago Falkner (Lago Filo Hua Hum) is located in the Nahuel Napi National Park. Around it's shores are many forest trails and gravel roads, popular for mountain biking.

Name: Lago Frias (Los Glaciares)
Description: Visit this lake and its glaciers on our Riding to Hidden Glaciers trip.
Description (with html): Visit this lake and its glaciers on our Riding to Hidden Glaciers trip.

Name: Lago Futalaufquen
Description: Lago Futalaufquen ( futa meaning big ; laufquen meaning lake) is the source of water that ultimately flows into the Rio Futaleufu (yes, you guessed it big river ), one of the world's most renowned whitewater rafting rivers, and one that flows all the way to the Pacific ocean.
Description (with html): Lago Futalaufquen (futa meaning big; laufquen meaning lake) is the source of water that ultimately flows into the Rio Futaleufu (yes, you guessed it big river), one of the world's most renowned whitewater rafting rivers, and one that flows all the way to the Pacific ocean.

Name: Lago General Carrera
Description: The biggest lake in Chile, it crosses the Chilean-Argentine border and is share by both countries. (In Argentina, it is known as Lago Buenos Aires). The lake's glacial waters drain into the Pacific via the Rio Baker, Chile's most voluminous river. The area was highly isolated for many years and accessible only from the Argentine side. However, the construction of the Carretera has allowed for tourism to boom here, becoming a very popular destiation for Chileans on their summer holidays. The major attraction is the Marble Cathedral (Marmol de Catedral, a.k.a. the Marble Caves).
Description (with html): The biggest lake in Chile, it crosses the Chilean-Argentine border and is share by both countries. (In Argentina, it is known as Lago Buenos Aires). The lake's glacial waters drain into the Pacific via the Rio Baker, Chile's most voluminous river. The area was highly isolated for many years and accessible only from the Argentine side. The major attraction is the Marble Cathedral (Marmol de Catedral, a.k.a. the Marble Caves).

Name: Lago Grey and Grey beach
Description: From the beach at the southern end of Lago Grey you get spectacular views of Glacier Grey far away at the northern end, some 17km walking distance away. You can reach Grey beach by taking a private transfer from Puerto Natales or coming at it from within the park, by crossing the lake by boat. The boat sets off from Refugio Grey near the spiky point at the top right of the lake by the glacier, at 1pm. It's lovely to walk along Grey beach and there are some W Trek trips, winter trips and kayaking trips that allow you to make the most of the views of los Cuernos mountains and the Paine Massif from this angle.
Description (with html): From the beach at the southern end of Lago Grey you get spectacular views of Glacier Grey far away at the northern end, some 17km walking distance away. You can reach Grey beach by taking a private transfer from Puerto Natales or coming at it from within the park, by crossing the lake by boat. The boat sets off from Refugio Grey near the spiky point at the top right of the lake by the glacier, at 1pm. It's lovely to walk along Grey beach and there are some W Trek trips, winter trips and kayaking trips that allow you to make the most of the views of los Cuernos mountains and the Paine Massif from this angle.

Name: Lago Hess
Description: Within easy reach of Bariloche and yet accessible to very few this lake is great for kayaking, often on a 2-3 day trip.
Description (with html): Within easy reach of Bariloche and yet accessible to very few this lake is great for kayaking, often on a 2-3 day trip.

Name: Lago Jeinemeni National Park
Description: Lago Jeinimeni National Park is a stunning wilderness area in the Aysén Region of Chilean Patagonia, now integrated as a sector within the expansive Patagonia National Park. It is known for its beautiful turquoise lake, dramatic mountain landscapes, and unique attractions, including ancient rock art and the striking "Piedra Clavada" rock formation.
Description (with html): Lago Jeinemeni National Park

Name: Lago Lacar
Description: Lago Lácar is a stunning glacial lake in Argentine Patagonia's Lanín National Park, famous for its deep blue waters surrounded by lush forests and mountains. It serves as the picturesque setting and main recreational hub for the popular tourist city of San Martín de los Andes, which sits on its eastern shore.
Description (with html):
↵↵↵↵↵↵
Lago Lacar
↵

Name: Lago Las Rocas
Description: Close to the border with Argentina, this tranquil lake in the Chilean Lake District is difficult to reach by car and is usually accessed by motorboat, on foot or on horseback. Isla Barrundias, a small island in the northern part of the lake is privately owned and many horse riding groups stay at the picturesque lodge there. With just a few short boat rides across Lago Rocas, Lago Inferior and the rapids in the middle of Lago Puelo, you will arrive in Argentina within a couple of hours.
Description (with html): Close to the border with Argentina, this tranquil lake in the Chilean Lake District is difficult to reach by car and is usually accessed by motorboat, on foot or on horseback. With just a few short boat rides across Lago Rocas, Lago Inferior and the rapids in the middle of Lago Puelo, you will arrive in Argentina within a couple of hours.

Name: Lago Maihue
Description: Lago Maihue is a beautiful, glacier-fed lake in the Andes mountains of southern Chile, located in the Los Ríos Region. It is known for its serene, pristine waters surrounded by dense native forests and is a popular destination for fishing, kayaking, and relaxation, draining west into the larger Ranco Lake.
Description (with html):
↵↵↵↵↵↵
Lago Maihue
↵

Name: Lago Mascardi
Description: Many people come to Bariloche to kayak on and explore its beautiful lakes, and this lake is no exception. A reasonably still and quiet lake, it's a perfect place to kayak and take in spectacular views of surrounding mountains and forests. There is also the option of float fishing here.
Description (with html): Many people come to Bariloche to kayak on and explore its beautiful lakes, and this lake is no exception. A reasonably still and quiet lake, it's a perfect place to kayak and take in spectacular views of surrounding mountains and forests. There is also the option of float fishing here.

Name: Lago Moreno
Description: For spectacular views out over the region and for fantastic kayaking opportunities, Lago Perito Moreno (named after the famous scientist and national Argentinian hero, Perito Francisco Moreno), the Lago Moreno is set against a backdrop of forests and lakes as far as the eye can see. For first time kayakers and for those looking for the calm waters of a lake rather than some rough and ready sea kayaking, Lago Perito Moreno offers a wonderful introduction to kayaking in the area. Find out more about this region on our kayaking in Bariloche page.
Description (with html):
For spectacular views out over the region and for fantastic kayaking opportunities, Lago Perito Moreno (named after the famous scientist and national Argentinian hero, Perito Francisco Moreno), the Lago Moreno is set against a backdrop of forests and lakes as far as the eye can see.

Name: Lago Nahuel Huapi
Description: Lago Nahuel Huapi is perfect for kayaking as its situated in the bustling tourist town of Bariloche, which has built up around this pristine lake. From Bariloche's many viewpoints you get greats vistas of Lago Nahuel Huapi and its surrounding lakes and mountains. More about the Argentine Lake District >>
Description (with html):
Lago Nahuel Huapi is perfect for kayaking as its situated in the bustling tourist town of Bariloche, which has built up around this pristine lake.

From Bariloche's many viewpoints you get greats vistas of Lago Nahuel Huapi and its surrounding lakes and mountains.

More about the Argentine Lake District >>

Name: Lago Nahuel Huapi (Tristeza branch)
Description: The Lago Nahuel Huapi is 6.3 miles wide and gives its name to the nearby national park. One of its branches, named 'Sadness branch' or Brazo Tristeza, is surrounded by towering, snow-capped mountains, lush forests and lakes as far as the eye can see. Nearby is the ever growing town of Bariloche, a sort of alpine-style place, famous for its chocolate making. It is here that many great kayaking itineraries start out and take you down to Tristeza branch via private transfer. If you're coming to this part of the Argentinian Patagonia Lake District, kayaking in the quiet waters of the Nahuel Huapi branch is definitely not to be missed, as well as hiking and mountain biking in the nearby hills and visiting the luxury ski resort of Cerro Catedral.

Name: Lago Nordenskjold
Description: Lying in the heart of Torres del Paine National Park, Lago Nordenskjold is a lake with unique colours, at the south western end of which you will find the magnificent Salto Grande waterfall. Walking along the shore of the lake affords spectacular views of Valle Frances and the Paine Massif.
Description (with html): Lying in the heart of Torres del Paine National Park, Lago Nordenskjold is a lake with unique colours, at the south western end of which you will find the magnificent Salto Grande waterfall. Walking along the shore of the lake affords spectacular views of Valle Frances and the Paine Massif.

Name: Lago O'Higgins / San Martín
Description: This is a huge lake fed by several glaciers in the North of the El Chalten and Fitz Roy region. The lake spans the border of Chile and Argentina and is known as Lago O'Higgins in Chile but Lago San Martin in Argentina.
Description (with html): This is a huge lake fed by several glaciers in the North of the El Chalten and Fitz Roy region. The lake spans the border of Chile and Argentina and is known as Lago O'Higgins in Chile but Lago San Martin in Argentina.

Name: Lago Paine
Description: A beautiful turquoise green lake in the northern part of Torres del Paine National Park, Lago Paine is one of the highlights of the Full Circuit and is seen by only 5% of the visitors to the park. The lake is reasonably close to Lago Dickson, another beautiful lake in this part of Patagonia and a popular area for cycling and horse riding. It's also from here that you have fantastic views of the Paine Massif and the back of the Torres, from which the park gets its name. Find out more visiting Torres del Paine.
Description (with html):
A beautiful turquoise green lake in the northern part of Torres del Paine National Park, Lago Paine is one of the highlights of the Full Circuit and is seen by only 5% of the visitors to the park.

↵

The lake is reasonably close to Lago Dickson, another beautiful lake in this part of Patagonia and a popular area for cycling and horse riding. It's also from here that you have fantastic views of the Paine Massif and the back of the Torres, from which the park gets its name. Find out more visiting Torres del Paine.

Name: Lago Pehoe
Description: Lago Pehoe sits at the centre of Torres del Paine National Park, and from it you have wonderful views of the Paine Grande mountain and the Cuernos (horns) del Paine. Pehoe is a tehuelche word meaning 'hidden' and is pronounced "pay-oh-way".On its northwestern shore lies Refugio Paine Grande, one of the key paces to spend a night on the W Trek. Watching the sun set on Lago Pehoe from Camping or Refugio Paine Grande is a peaceful and rewarding end to a day of hiking along the Grey Lake or up the French Valley . To the North East is the Salto Grande waterfall, and to the South East the Salto Chico waterfall and a number of accommodation options: Hosteria Pehoe, Camping Pehoe and the Explora Hotel . Most visitors first catch a glimpse of the lake whilst hiking the W Trek. However, the views from its Western shores are wonderful and the 4 to 5 hour hike (or horseride) up from the National Park's administration centre is a relatively flat and less trodden route.The lake is large, more than 10km wide, and the ferry across takes approximately an hour, from Paine Grande Lodge to the North East .
Description (with html):
Lago Pehoe sits at the centre of Torres del Paine National Park, and from it you have wonderful views of the Paine Grande mountain and the Cuernos (horns) del Paine. Pehoe is a tehuelche word meaning 'hidden' and is pronounced "pay-oh-way".

On its northwestern shore lies Refugio Paine Grande, one of the key paces to spend a night on the W Trek. Watching the sun set on Lago Pehoe from Camping or Refugio Paine Grande is a peaceful and rewarding end to a day of hiking along the Grey Lake or up the French Valley. To the North East is the Salto Grande waterfall, and to the South East the Salto Chico waterfall and a number of accommodation options: Hosteria Pehoe, Camping Pehoe and the Explora Hotel.

Most visitors first catch a glimpse of the lake whilst hiking the W Trek. However, the views from its Western shores are wonderful and the 4 to 5 hour hike (or horseride) up from the National Park's administration centre is a relatively flat and less trodden route.

The lake is large, more than 10km wide, and the ferry across takes approximately an hour, from Paine Grande Lodge to the North East.

Name: Lago Puelo
Description: Perhaps one of the bluest lakes in the Argentinian lake district, Lago Puelo is vast and calm, apart from the fast flowing rapids in the middle of the lake, which can be crossed on a motor boat. After crossing Puelo, you're about a hour's drive from El Bolson, a small hippy town, with a small market selling artesan products and good ice cream parlours. For best views of the snow-capped mountains in the distance, get up early and catch Ken's motor boat across the lake whilst there's still some mist.
Description (with html): Perhaps one of the bluest lakes in the Argentinian lake district, Lago Puelo is vast and calm, apart from the fast flowing rapids in the middle of the lake, which can be crossed on a motor boat. After crossing Puelo, you're about a hour's drive from El Bolson, a small hippy town, with a small market selling artesan products and good ice cream parlours. For best views of the snow-capped mountains in the distance, get up early and catch Ken's motor boat across the lake whilst there's still some mist.

Name: Lago Quemado
Description: This small lake in the very northern part of Torres del Paine, is one of the highlights of getting off the beaten track. A hike to Lago or Laguna Quemada gives you a unique view of Glacier Dickson, especially if you leave early from Refugio Dickson. From the lake it's also possible to continue along an old baqueano trail to the international police post. This quiet and picturesque part of the park is usually reached whilst trekking the Full Circuit of Torres del Paine.

Name: Lago Rivadavia
Description: Just off the road from El Bolson to Esquel this is a beautiful lake in the Los Alerces National Park.
Description (with html): Just off the road from El Bolson to Esquel this is a beautiful lake in the Los Alerces National Park.

Name: Lago Roca (Julia A Roca)
Description: A few miles from Bariloche, often visited on kayaking trips, this lake fed by the Manso river is close to the Chilean border.
Description (with html): A few miles from Bariloche, often visited on kayaking trips, this lake fed by the Manso river is close to the Chilean border.

Name: Lago Sarmiento
Description: Lake Sarmiento is located in Torres del Paine National Park, in Chile. It is named after Spanish explorer Pedro Sarmiento de Gamboa, and gives its name to one of the areas in the National Park Torres del Paine. Its edge is marked by extensive calcium carbonate ‘Thrombolite’ deposits, possibly from hydrothermal activity in the lake.
Description (with html): Lake Sarmiento is located in Torres del Paine National Park, in Chile. It is named after Spanish explorer Pedro Sarmiento de Gamboa, and gives its name to one of the areas in the National Park Torres del Paine. Its edge is marked by extensive calcium carbonate ‘Thrombolite’ deposits, possibly from hydrothermal activity in the lake.

Name: Lago Tamango National Park
Description: Also known as Lago Cochrane National park.
Description (with html): Also known as Lago Cochrane National park.

Name: Lago Todos los Santos
Description: A vast and turquoise blue lake in the Chilean Lake District, All Saints Lake is close to Puerto Varas and within the boundaries of the Vicente Pérez Rosales National Park. Although a beautiful place, few people kayak on or trek close to the lake, it's rather used as a means of getting across the many lakes in the Chilean Lake District over to Argentina or vice versa by boat. More information about the Lake District >>

Name: Lago Tyndall
Description: Fed by the meltwaters of Glaciar Tyndall which comes down from the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, Tyndall Lake can be reached via the Tyndall River, just outside the boundaries of Torres del Paine National Park. A hotspot for kayaking trips, on Lago Tyndall you paddle up the icy walls of the 12000-year old glacier and enjoy lunch on the lake's sandy shores.

Name: Lago Vidal
Description: Deep-blue lake in the heart of the Cochamo Valley.
Description (with html): Deep-blue lake in the heart of the Cochamo Valley.

Name: Lago Viedma
Description: Lago Viedma is a large lake in Los Glaciares National Park, fed primarily by the enormous Glaciar Viedma.
Description (with html): Lago Viedma is a large lake in Los Glaciares National Park, fed primarily by the enormous Glaciar Viedma.

Name: Lago Yehuin
Description: One of Tierra del Fuego's huge blue lakes, Lago Yehuin is visited on a trekking adventure in the Argentinian part of Tierra del Fuego, close to Ushuaia and the gigantic Lago Fagnano. It's not an easy location to reach so is definitely best visited with a local guide from the area. Find more information about trekking in Tierra del Fuego and visiting the southernmost city in the world, Ushuaia.
Description (with html):
One of Tierra del Fuego's huge blue lakes, Lago Yehuin is visited on a trekking adventure in the Argentinian part of Tierra del Fuego, close to Ushuaia and the gigantic Lago Fagnano. It's not an easy location to reach so is definitely best visited with a local guide from the area.

↵

Find more information about trekking in Tierra del Fuego and visiting the southernmost city in the world, Ushuaia.

Name: Lago Yelcho
Description: A large lake in the Futaleufu river system, Lago Yelcho boasts an abundance of Brown and Rainbow trout and is a great spot for fly fishing. The lake is in a quiet and secluded area with lovely views of the surrounding mountains. Good accommodation and guides are provided at the Isla Monita Lodge, which is situated on a private island on the lake.
Description (with html): A large lake in the Futaleufu river system, Lago Yelcho boasts an abundance of Brown and Rainbow trout and is a great spot for fly fishing. The lake is in a quiet and secluded area with lovely views of the surrounding mountains. Good accommodation and guides are provided at the Isla Monita Lodge, which is situated on a private island on the lake.

Name: Laguna 3 de Abril
Description: The Laguna 3 de Abril is located in the Los Glaciares National Park in Argentina. There is an outpost near the lake where horse-riders can stay overnight.
Description (with html): The Laguna 3 de Abril is located in the Los Glaciares National Park in Argentina. There is an outpost near the lake where horse-riders can stay overnight.

Name: Laguna Amarga
Description: Laguna Amarga is one of the best places on earth to observe pumas in the wild. Nowhere else the population density is as high as on this Ranch. Previously it was common practice for the land owners to hunt pumas, in order to avoid that those kill their sheep. Now however, there has grown a new generation on the Estancias, advocating for a tolerant cooperation. Now you can watch the pumas in their natural habitat while on the same Estancia there is being practiced livestock farming, whereupon the sheep are being guarded by livestock guardian dogs, so that they don’t fall prey to the pumas. Read our guide to puma tracking in Torres del Paine
Description (with html):
Laguna Amarga is one of the best places on earth to observe pumas in the wild. Nowhere else the population density is as high as on this Ranch. Previously it was common practice for the land owners to hunt pumas, in order to avoid that those kill their sheep. Now however, there has grown a new generation on the Estancias, advocating for a tolerant cooperation. Now you can watch the pumas in their natural habitat while on the same Estancia there is being practiced livestock farming, whereupon the sheep are being guarded by livestock guardian dogs, so that they don’t fall prey to the pumas.

Read our guide to puma tracking in Torres del Paine

Name: Laguna Anita
Description: Laguna Anita is located in the Los Glaciares National Park. It is visited on a trek through the area and there is a campsite here.
Description (with html): Laguna Anita is located in the Los Glaciares National Park. It is visited on a trek through the area and there is a campsite here.

Name: Laguna Azul
Description: Laguna Azul lies in the North East of Torres del Paine National Park. Its eastern edge can be reached by road/track and there's a campsite. It doesn't sit on either the W or the Full Circuit, but is accessible on guided treks and horseriding trips. It is also a popular location for puma-tracking.
Description (with html):
Laguna Azul lies in the North East of Torres del Paine National Park. Its eastern edge can be reached by road/track and there's a campsite.

It doesn't sit on either the W or the Full Circuit, but is accessible on guided treks and horseriding trips.  It is also a popular location for puma-tracking.

Name: Laguna Azul (Los Glaciares)
Description: Laguna Azul is located in the Los Glaciares region. It is visited on a hike through lenga and ñirre forests.
Description (with html): Laguna Azul is located in the Los Glaciares region. It is visited on a hike through lenga and ñirre forests.

Name: Laguna Capri (Pato)
Description: Known to some as Laguna Pato and to others as Laguna Capri, this lake is around a two hour trek from El Chalten. There is a campsite beside the lake and from this area there are great views of the famous Cerro Fitz Roy and surrounding peaks.
Description (with html): Known to some as Laguna Pato and to others as Laguna Capri, this lake is around a two hour trek from El Chalten. There is a campsite beside the lake and from this area there are great views of the famous Cerro Fitz Roy and surrounding peaks.

Name: Laguna Castillo
Description: A lovely viewpoint in Cerro Castillo National Reserve, next to the Lagoon with views of the glaciers and forests in the reserve.
Description (with html): A lovely viewpoint in Cerro Castillo National Reserve, next to the Lagoon with views of the glaciers and forests in the reserve.

Name: Laguna Cejar
Description: Laguna Cejar is a stunning, highly saline lagoon located in the Atacama Salt Flat near San Pedro de Atacama, Chile, famous for its incredible buoyancy that allows visitors to float effortlessly on its turquoise waters, similar to the Dead Sea.
Description (with html):
↵↵↵↵↵↵
Laguna Cejar
↵

Name: Laguna Chaxa
Description: Laguna Chaxa is a saltwater lagoon located within the Salar de Atacama (Atacama Salt Flat) in northern Chile, famous for being a key part of the Los Flamencos National Reserve and one of the best places in the world to observe three different species of flamingos.
Description (with html): Laguna Chaxa is a saltwater lagoon located within the Salar de Atacama (Atacama Salt Flat) in northern Chile, famous for being a key part of the Los Flamencos National Reserve and one of the best places in the world to observe three different species of flamingos.

Name: Laguna de los Palos
Description: Laguna de los Palos is a productive alkaline lagoon, usually visited on a day trip from Punta Arenas.
Description (with html): Laguna de los Palos is a productive alkaline lagoon, usually visited on a day trip from Punta Arenas.

Name: Laguna de Los Tres
Description: Laguna de los Tres is probably the most famous and most popular viewpoint for Cerro Fitz Roy. "Los Tres" refers to the three peaks that you can see from the laguna's shore: Fitz Roy (3,405m), Poincenot (3,002m), and Saint-Exupéry (2,558m), but the view is magnificient around all 360 degrees.This is a very popular destination, for good reason, so don't expect any solitude if you're there between November and February. The path up is well trodden and relatively easy going, with some steeper sections towards the top. Whilst there's only one approach to the laguna and the viewpoint, you can incorporate it into your itinerary in a few different ways: - Day hike from El Chalten. This is a route where you have to retrace your steps, but it's a varied and interesting route and the round-trip might take around 8 to 9 hours. - Start from Hosteria Pilar or Piedra del Fraile campsite to the North, and return back to El Chalten at the end of the day. This is again a full day of around 8 to 9 hours, but has the benefit of taking in Glaciar Piedras Blancas in the first part of the day, and you don't need to retrace your steps. - Use Camping Poincenot as base. This is a good option if you want to break it into shorter days; from here it's about an hour up to the viewpoint. The campsite is nice, if a little busy, and around a 3 hour hike from El Chalten.
Description (with html):
Laguna de los Tres is probably the most famous and most popular viewpoint for Cerro Fitz Roy. "Los Tres" refers to the three peaks that you can see from the laguna's shore: Fitz Roy (3,405m), Poincenot (3,002m), and Saint-Exupéry (2,558m), but the view is magnificient around all 360 degrees.

This is a very popular destination, for good reason, so don't expect any solitude if you're there between November and February. The path up is well trodden and relatively easy going, with some steeper sections towards the top.

Whilst there's only one approach to the laguna and the viewpoint, you can incorporate it into your itinerary in a few different ways:

 - Day hike from El Chalten. This is a route where you have to retrace your steps, but it's a varied and interesting route and the round-trip might take around 8 to 9 hours.
 - Start from Hosteria Pilar or Piedra del Fraile campsite to the North, and return back to El Chalten at the end of the day. This is again a full day of around 8 to 9 hours, but has the benefit of taking in Glaciar Piedras Blancas in the first part of the day, and you don't need to retrace your steps.
 - Use Camping Poincenot as base. This is a good option if you want to break it into shorter days; from here it's about an hour up to the viewpoint. The campsite is nice, if a little busy, and around a 3 hour hike from El Chalten.

Name: Laguna del Caminante
Description: Main campsite along the Montes Martial trekking route in Tierra del Fuego national park.
Description (with html): Main campsite along the Montes Martial trekking route in Tierra del Fuego national park.

Name: Laguna Honda
Description: Laguna Honda is located in Torres del Paine National Park. It can be visited using the Alto del Toro or Paso La Feria trails.
Description (with html): Laguna Honda is located in Torres del Paine National Park. It can be visited using the Alto del Toro or Paso La Feria trails.

Name: Laguna Huemul
Description: Laguna Huemul is a small lake fed by a glacier of the same name in the North of Los Glaciares National Park. The lake is adjacent to the much larger Lago del Desierto, and this is a very picturesque area for trekking.
Description (with html): Laguna Huemul is a small lake fed by a glacier of the same name in the North of Los Glaciares National Park. The lake is adjacent to the much larger Lago del Desierto, and this is a very picturesque area for trekking.

Name: Laguna Jakob
Description: Laguna Jakob is a small lake in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park. Beside the lake is a mountain hut, called Refugio Jakob or San Martin.
Description (with html): Laguna Jakob is a small lake in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park. Beside the lake is a mountain hut,  called Refugio Jakob or San Martin.

Name: Laguna Linda
Description: Laguna Linda is located in the Torres del Paine National Park.
Description (with html): Laguna Linda is located in the Torres del Paine National Park.

Name: Laguna Los Guanacos
Description: Laguna Los Guanacos is located in Chilean Patagonia. Trekkers often camp on the shore of the lagoon.
Description (with html): Laguna Los Guanacos is located in Chilean Patagonia. Trekkers often camp on the shore of the lagoon.

Name: Laguna Los Perros
Description: Laguna Los Perros in the northern part of Torres del Paine National Park is a small lake with the large Glacier Perros flowing into it. It's one of the many highlights of the Full Circuit trek, which takes 8-10 days to complete, along with Paso John Garner, which looks out over the sprawling Glacier Grey. Perros offers a campsite for hikers and did used to have a refugio, but sadly this burnt down a couple of years ago. To find out more, read our guide to Torres del Paine.

Name: Laguna los Tempanos
Description: Laguna Los Tempanos is a small lake in Nahuel Huapi National Park, which you will pass on the 3rd day of a 4 day hut-to-hut hike through the mountains.

Name: Laguna Navidad
Description: This is a very small lake in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park.
Description (with html): This is a very small lake in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park.

Name: Laguna Negra
Description: This is a small lake in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park. Beside the lake is a mountain hut, Refugio Italia/Laguna Negra, which provides accommodation for those trekking in the mountains.
Description (with html): This is a small lake in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park. Beside the lake is a mountain hut, Refugio Italia/Laguna Negra, which provides accommodation for those trekking in the mountains.

Name: Laguna Piedras Blancas
Description: Laguna Piedras Blancas is filled by the meltwater of the beautiful and dramatic glacier of the same name, which descending from the East of Mount Fitz Roy. You can hike to Piedras Blancas from the north along the valley of the Rio Blanco. On its eastern edge (from Hosteria El Pilar), or its western edge (from Piedra del Fraile campsite). In the case of the latter you can actually reach the shore of the laguna.

Name: Laguna Pollone
Description: A small lake in the Pollone Valley, Laguna Pollone can be reached by hiking from Piedra del Fraile campsite. From the lake, you get stunning views of Aguila Pollone, Glaciar Fitz Roy Norte and the North face of Mt. Fitz Roy in one direction, and Glaciar Marconi and Lago Electrico in the other.

Name: Laguna San Rafael
Description: A beautiful lake next to the national park with the same name.
Description (with html): A beautiful lake next to the national park with the same name.

Name: Laguna San Rafael National Park
Description: Named after the gloriously blue San Rafael Lagoon, formed by the meltwater of San Rafael Glacier. In 1979 the Park was designated a UNESCO World Biosphere Reserve and some of the highest peaks of the Patagonian Andes (Mt Valentin). Its protected status means that it is home to many kinds of wildlife, including Chilean dolphins, sea lions, marine otters, and elephant seals.

Name: Laguna Schmoll
Description: This is a very small lake in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park, which you'll pass when hiking from Refugio Frey to Refugio Jakob/San Martin on the second day of a 4 day hut-to-hut hike.
Description (with html): This is a very small lake in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park, which you'll pass when hiking from Refugio Frey to Refugio Jakob/San Martin on the second day of a 4 day hut-to-hut hike.

Name: Laguna Sofia
Description: Found in Torres del Paine National Park in Chile, Laguna Sofia is a fantastic place for fishing and home to an abundance of trout. This quiet and tranquil spot is a lovely place to wile away the hours and relax, while appreciating the wonderful landscape around you. Find out more about visiting Torres del Paine.

Name: Laguna Sucia
Description: Laguna Sucia is located next to the famous Laguna de los Tres and is accessible on a day-hike from the town of El Chalten. From the shore of the lake, you can see Glaciar Rio Blanco feeding into the lake and Mount Fitz Roy above it.
Description (with html): Laguna Sucia is located next to the famous Laguna de los Tres and is accessible on a day-hike from the town of El Chalten. From the shore of the lake, you can see Glaciar Rio Blanco feeding into the lake and Mount Fitz Roy above it.

Name: Laguna Tonchek
Description: Laguna Tonchek is a small lake up in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park. There is a mountain hut, Refugio Frey, beside the lake which provides accommodation.
Description (with html): Laguna Tonchek is a small lake up in the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park. There is a mountain hut, Refugio Frey, beside the lake which provides accommodation.

Name: Laguna Toro (Tunel)
Description: Laguna Toro, sometimes called Tunel, lies on the Huemul Circuit, which is one of the longer treks that can be started from El Chalten. The lake is fed by Glaciars Rio Superior and Inferior, and from it flows Rio Tunel.
Description (with html): Laguna Toro, sometimes called Tunel, lies on the Huemul Circuit, which is one of the longer treks that can be started from El Chalten. The lake is fed by Glaciars Rio Superior and Inferior, and from it flows Rio Tunel.

Name: Laguna Torre
Description: Laguna Torre is the pale lake into which the huge Glaciar Grande feeds, after coming down from the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap. There is an enjoyable trek up to both lake and glacier from El Chalten along the pictureseque Rio Fitz Roy.
Description (with html): Laguna Torre is the pale lake into which the huge Glaciar Grande feeds, after coming down from the Southern Patagonian Ice Cap. There is an enjoyable trek up to both lake and glacier from El Chalten along the pictureseque Rio Fitz Roy.

Name: Laguna Verde (Mirador del Toro)
Description: Laguna Verde sits to the south of the main trails and peaks of the W Trek. This is a more gentle hike but with magnificent views of the Paine Massif, and excellent opportunities to see the park's wildlife.
Description (with html): Laguna Verde sits to the south of the main trails and peaks of the W Trek. This is a more gentle hike but with magnificent views of the Paine Massif, and excellent opportunities to see the park's wildlife.

Name: Lagunas Madre, Hija & Nieta
Description: This is a group of three lakes, which lies on a trekking route not far from the town of El Chalten, in the shadow of Mount Fitz Roy. Laguna Madre is the largest and its name literally means 'mother'. The next largest is Hija, meaning 'daughter', and the smallest by far is Nieta, meaning 'granddaughter'.
Description (with html): This is a group of three lakes, which lies on a trekking route not far from the town of El Chalten, in the shadow of Mount Fitz Roy. Laguna Madre is the largest and its name literally means 'mother'. The next largest is Hija, meaning 'daughter', and the smallest by far is Nieta, meaning 'granddaughter'.

Name: Lagunas Miscanti and Miñiques
Description: Lagunas Miscanti and Miñiques are located just off Route 23, south of San Pedro de Atacama. The intense blue-coloured waters of the lake contrast strikingly with the volcanoes that tower above them.
Description (with html): Lagunas Miscanti and Miñiques are located just off Route 23, south of San Pedro de Atacama. The intense blue-coloured waters of the lake contrast strikingly with the volcanoes that tower above them.

Name: Lake Esmerelda
Description: Lake Esmerelda is located in Tierra del Fuego, just south of Glacier Ojo del Albino.
Description (with html): Lake Esmerelda is located in Tierra del Fuego, just south of Glacier Ojo del Albino.

Name: Lake Filo Hua Hum
Description: Two hours drive from both Bariloche and San Martín de los Andes, Lake Filo Hua Hum is a popular camping destination for cyclists. The quiet gravel roads in this area are perfect for mountain biking, allowing cyclists to pedal from between a number of secluded lakes here. The Filo Hua Hum river runs through the lake on its way to nearby Lake Falkner. It is well-stocked with both brown and rainbow trout, making it a top fly fishing destination. The fish rise at their most enthusiastic in the lake from December to February, allowing food fishing from drift boats.There is a tranquil campsite on the southern shore of the lake. A gravel road north from Filo Hua Hum leads to Lake Meliquina , and on to San Martín de los Andes.
Description (with html):
Two hours drive from both Bariloche and San Martín de los Andes, Lake Filo Hua Hum is a popular camping destination for cyclists. The quiet gravel roads in this area are perfect for mountain biking, allowing cyclists to pedal from between a number of secluded lakes here.

The Filo Hua Hum river runs through the lake on its way to nearby Lake Falkner. It is well-stocked with both brown and rainbow trout, making it a top fly fishing destination. The fish rise at their most enthusiastic in the lake from December to February, allowing food fishing from drift boats.

There is a tranquil campsite on the southern shore of the lake. A gravel road north from Filo Hua Hum leads to Lake Meliquina, and on to San Martín de los Andes.

Name: Lake Frias
Description: Lake Frias is fed by the Frias Glacier on the slopes of Tronador Volcano. At the southern end of the lake is Puerto Frias and at the northern end is Puerto Alegre. From there a road runs to Puerto Blest from where boats sail to Puerto Pañuelo, near Bariloche.
Description (with html): Lake Frias is fed by the Frias Glacier on the slopes of Tronador Volcano. At the southern end of the lake is Puerto Frias and at the northern end is Puerto Alegre. From there a road runs to Puerto Blest from where boats sail to Puerto Pañuelo, near Bariloche.

Name: Lake Machónico
Description: A crystal clear lake, fed by glaciers that is a popular spot for kayaking and rowing.
Description (with html): A crystal clear lake, fed by glaciers that is a popular spot for kayaking and rowing.

Name: Lake Nuevo
Description: Lake Nuevo (940m) is a popular destination for cyclists and can be reached by a trail from Lake Filo Hua Hum.
Description (with html): Lake Nuevo (940m) is a popular destination for cyclists and can be reached by a trail from Lake Filo Hua Hum.

Name: Lake Paimún
Description: Lake Paimún is visited on the trek from Aila.There is a fully-supported campsite here.

Lake Paimún is visited on the trek from Aila.

There is a fully-supported campsite here.

Name: Lake Tagua Tagua
Description: Lake Tagua Tagua is a glacial finger lake in the Chilean Lake District sitting in 3000 hectares of forest that was turned into a Private Protected Area in 2013 dedicated to ecotourism. Access is by boat from the jetty at Puerto Canelo on Tagua Tagua’s northernmost point, a short walk from a cascading waterfall that marks the point where the Puelo River flows out of the lake to begin its descent to the Reconlavi Fjord. It’s possible to kayak near the falls or paddle to one of the lake’s many stony beaches. The surrounding landscape is thick with temperate rainforest and braided with well-marked hiking trails and walkways that climb the park’s steep slopes. The forest is well planted with Chilean cypress trees as well as ancient alerces, some of which might be as old as 3000 years. Under their branches, the forest floor is thick with ferns and fuschias that thrive in the damp alpine climate. The park has three refugios, Notros, Alerces and Quetrus. The first is near the entrance to the park, while the other two reward hikers prepared for a 7km and 10km respectively with truly spectacular locations. Refugio Alerces looks out across the ghostly fingers of long-dead alerces trees poking out from the waters, while Refugio Quetrus is at is near a smaller lake of the same name, which opens out to give tremendous views of the surrounding granite peaks. At the southern end of Lake Tagua Tagua is the Mitico Puelo Lodge , a former fishing lodge offering hikers a taste of mountain luxury. Lake Tagua Tagua is around a four hour drive from either Puerto Montt or Puerto Varas, via Cochamó. Mitico Puelo Lodge is a 40-minute boat ride from the Puerto Canelo jetty.

Name: Lake Toro Heights
Description: Lake Toro Heights is a spectacular viewpoint in Torres del Paine National Park. From here there are 360-degree views.

Name: Lakutaia Lodge
Description: This lodge is located in Tierra del Fuego, at the tip of South America, and is a base for some unique excursions in this remote part of the world. You can sail the Beagle Channel, fly over Cape Horn and see the spectacular fjords, glaciers and wildlife of the area.

Name: Lanin National Park
Description: Lanín National Park is a vast national park in Argentine Patagonia, dominated by the iconic, snow-capped Lanín Volcano and known for its ancient forests, numerous glacial lakes, and extensive opportunities for hiking, climbing, and outdoor recreation.
Description (with html): Lanin National Park

Name: Lapataia Bay
Description: Found in the heart of the Tierra del Fuego National Park, Lapataia Bay offers a secluded spot to kayak and see many native varieties of Patagonian birds including the Patagonian goose. This is one of the highlights of kayaking in Tierra del Fuego as you are able to paddle alongside colonies of cormorants and even past seals. If you're lucky you'll spot a couple of minxes that live in this area too. Find out more about visiting Tierra del Fuego either by kayak or by foot.

Name: Lapostolle Winery
Description: Lapostolle Winery is a renowned Chilean winery, founded by Alexandra Marnier Lapostolle (of the Grand Marnier family), located primarily in the Colchagua Valley, specifically near the town of Santa Cruz and particularly in the famous Apalta Valley. It is celebrated for combining French winemaking expertise with Chile's exceptional terroir to produce world-class wines, most notably their iconic "Clos Apalta."

Name: Las Juntas Valley
Description: This amphitheatre of granite mountains can be reached after a 3 hour horse ride through rain forest and across a river protected from a hydro-electricity plan. These granite peaks are perfect for climbing in summer and are snow-capped in Patagonian winter (end of Apr-start of Sep).

Name: Liquine
Description: Liquine sits on the Chilean side of the border and you can see the snow-topped Volcan Villarica to the North.

Name: Llaima volcano
Description: Directly east of Temuco, 3,125-meter Volcan Llama's smoldering crater is Parque National Conguillio's most eye-catching feature; since colonial time, Chile's second most active volcano has recorded dozens of violent eruptions.
Description (with html): Directly east of Temuco, 3,125-meter Volcan Llama's smoldering crater is Parque National Conguillio's most eye-catching feature; since colonial time, Chile's second most active volcano has recorded dozens of violent eruptions.

Name: Llancahué Island
Description: Llancahué hot springs are the perfect place to chill out after a hard days kayaking on Llancahué Island close to Parque Nacional Hornopiren in Chilean Patagonia. These hot springs are really warm and can reach up to 52°C, making them great to relax. It takes about 50 minutes to get to the island by motorboat from Hornopirén via the Cholgo Channel and it's a great way to see this beautiful area of Patagonia which has lots of quaint fishing villages, hot springs, seals and whales.

Name: Loma de las Pizarras
Description: Loma de las Pizzaras, meaning 'The Slate Hill', stands at 1708 metres and can be climbed on a day-trek from the town of El Chalten. From its top, you can enjoy great views of Cerros Fitz Roy and Torre from a different angle to most viewpoints. Trekking from El Chalten >>

Name: Loma del Pliegue Tumbado
Description: Loma del Pliegue Tumbado is a chain of three peaks to the South West of El Chalten.
