If you're a more adventurous type, you may want to visit this beautiful region by kayak, as you'll get up close to the whales and paddle alongside sea lion colonies.

↵

Find out more about kayaking in Patagonia.

Name: Punta Tombo
Description: Punta Tombo is close to Peninsula Valdes in the northern part of Argentinian Patagonia. Here you'll find the world's largest colony of Magellanic penguins, with around 1 million penguins roosting here each year from September to April. Tours to see the penguins depart from nearby Trelew and Puerto Madryn regularly between October and March.
Description (with html):
Punta Tombo is close to Peninsula Valdes in the northern part of Argentinian Patagonia.

↵

Here you'll find the world's largest colony of Magellanic penguins, with around 1 million penguins roosting here each year from September to April. Tours to see the penguins depart from nearby Trelew and Puerto Madryn regularly between October and March.

Name: Puritama hot springs
Description: Puritama Hot Springs are a series of eight large, natural thermal pools located at the bottom of a canyon in the Atacama Desert, Chile. The mineral-rich, warm waters are a popular tourist destination for relaxation and rejuvenation, offering a surreal oasis in the arid landscape.
Description (with html): Puritama Hot Springs are a series of eight large, natural thermal pools located at the bottom of a canyon in the Atacama Desert, Chile. The mineral-rich, warm waters are a popular tourist destination for relaxation and rejuvenation, offering a surreal oasis in the arid landscape.

Name: Puyuhuapi
Description: Puyuhuapi is a small town in the northern section of the Carretera that is famous for its nearby hot springs, with various resorts to stay in an enjoy them amid beautiful landscapes. It is also an access point into Queulat National Park. It is a quaint town with German architectural influence, framed by high mountains covered with forests. Puyuhuapi is jjust 20km from Queulat National Park.
Description (with html):
Puyuhuapi is a small town in the northern section of the Carretera that is famous for its nearby hot springs, with various resorts to stay in an enjoy them amid beautiful landscapes. It is also an access point into Queulat National Park.

↵

It is a quaint town with German architectural influence, framed by high mountains covered with forests.  Puyuhuapi is jjust 20km from Queulat National Park.

Name: Quemchi
Description: Quemchi is a small village on the island of Chiloé in Chile. There is a museum here dedicated to the Chilean author Francisco Coloane.
Description (with html): Quemchi is a small village on the island of Chiloé in Chile. There is a museum here dedicated to the Chilean author Francisco Coloane.

Name: Quetrupillán volcano
Description: About midway between Volcan Villarrica and Voclan Quetrupillan, a rough summer-only road crosses the park from Termas de Palguin to the hot-springs town of Coñaripe.
Description (with html): About midway between Volcan Villarrica and Voclan Quetrupillan, a rough summer-only road crosses the park from Termas de Palguin to the hot-springs town of Coñaripe.

Name: Queulat National Park
Description: Home to 1 500 square km of glacier-topped peaks and evergreen forests, the area was originally explored in the 1700s by Spanish colonisers in search of the City of the Caesars. These days it is famous for its Hanging Glacier.
Description (with html): Home to 1 500 square km of glacier-topped peaks and evergreen forests, the area was originally explored in the 1700s by Spanish colonisers in search of the City of the Caesars.  These days it is famous for its Hanging Glacier.

Name: Quilquico
Description: Quilquico is a small village on Chiloé Island in Chile. It is visited as part of a horse-riding day trip from the Tierra Chiloé Hotel.
Description (with html): Quilquico is a small village on Chiloé Island in Chile. It is visited as part of a horse-riding day trip from the Tierra Chiloé Hotel.

Name: Quintupeo Fjord
Description: Located in the heart of Pumalin National Park in Chile's Patagonian Lake District, Quintupeo Fjord was known amongst locals as the hiding place of the German battleship 'The Dresden' during the Battle of the Falkland Islands in 1914. In this almost untouched place, kayaking is the best way to make the most of its waterfalls, huge sloping granite walls and close up views of its abundant trees and vegetation. It's a truly wild place to camp and everything is still and quiet save for a pod of austral dolphins or sea lions sunbathing nearby. Not far from the fjo r d you'll find the picturesque Island of Llancahué, where you can relax in its 52°C hot springs.
Description (with html):

Not far from the fjord you'll find the picturesque Island of Llancahué, where you can relax in its 52°C hot springs.

Name: Quitralco Fjord
Description: This fjord, in the green and largely undiscovered region of Aysen, is one of the stops during a 6-day adventure cruise around southern Patagonia's glaciers. It's here that guest enjoy bathing in the hot springs in covered or open air pools with temperatures ranging across 36º, 32º and 30º Celcius. You can also enjoy the calm and tranquil fjord which is bordered by green forests and snow capped mountains in the distance. Find out more about visiting the Quitralco Fjord on board an adventure cruise in Patagonia >>

Name: Rainbow Valley
Description: Rainbow Valley (Valle Arcoiris) is a geological marvel in the Atacama Desert near San Pedro de Atacama, Chile, famous for its hills and canyons that are naturally painted with vibrant stripes of red, green, white, and yellow from various mineral deposits, creating a landscape that looks like a painted canvas.
Description (with html):
↵↵↵↵↵↵
Rainbow Valley (Valle Arcoiris)

Name: Ramaditas Mountain Lodge
Description: Ramaditas Mountain Lodge is located on the edge of Laguna Ramaditas, in Bolivia, not far from the border with Chile.
Description (with html): Ramaditas Mountain Lodge is located on the edge of Laguna Ramaditas, in Bolivia, not far from the border with Chile.

Name: Refugia Chiloé Hotel
Description: Refugia Chiloé Hotel is a boutique spa island hotel resort where intrepid adventure vacations are coupled with comfort. Immerse yourself in the best of this archipelago, which is awash in verdant pastures, dramatic coastlines and scenic clifftops.
Description (with html): Refugia Chiloé Hotel is a boutique spa island hotel resort where intrepid adventure vacations are coupled with comfort. Immerse yourself in the best of this archipelago, which is awash in verdant pastures, dramatic coastlines and scenic clifftops.
NEW CUSTOM ADDRESS/WHAT3WORDS: Sector, San José, Castro, Los Lagos, Chile

Name: Refugio Agostino Rocca
Description: Refugio Agostino Rocca is located at 1400m, very close to the Paso de Las Nubes - the Pass of the Clouds.There are 80 beds in this modern refuge, split into ten rooms containing eight single beds each.
Description (with html):
Refugio Agostino Rocca is located at 1400m, very close to the Paso de Las Nubes - the Pass of the Clouds.

There are 80 beds in this modern refuge, split into ten rooms containing eight single beds each.

Name: Refugio Basico Pudeto
Description: This refugio is located close to the impressive Salto Grande waterfall, on the northern edge of Lago Pehoe. This is an area of Torres del Paine National Park that is much less visited than those that lie on the route of the W Trek.
Description (with html): This refugio is located close to the impressive Salto Grande waterfall, on the northern edge of Lago Pehoe. This is an area of Torres del Paine National Park that is much less visited than those that lie on the route of the W Trek.

Name: Refugio Cóndor
Description: This is a wilderness refugio on the shores of the Río de las Vueltas owned and operated exclusively by one of Swoop's partners. It's a very peaceful place, nicely designed, and the hosts are very friendly and good cooks.When staying here, you can use kayaks provided by the refugio on the nearby Lago Cóndor and mountain bike either north to Lago del Desierto, or south towards Laguna Azul. You might choose to cycle to Hosteria el Pilar, hike up to Laguna de Los Tres, and return in a day to a very good meal and bottle of wine. To get to the refugio, there is a complimentary 40-minute transfer from El Chaltén. To find out more about Refugio Cóndor or to book your stay, see our Hotels in El Chaltén page.

Name: Refugio Dickson
Description: Refugio Dickson is a shelter close to Glaciar Dickson, in a less visited part of Torres del Paine National Park. It has 30 beds as well as offering showers and basic meals.
Description (with html): Refugio Dickson is a shelter close to Glaciar Dickson, in a less visited part of Torres del Paine National Park. It has 30 beds as well as offering showers and basic meals.

Name: Refugio El Callao
Description: The Refugio El Callao is visited on an overnight stop on the Puntiagudo trek. There are hot springs 4km from here.
Description (with html): The Refugio El Callao is visited on an overnight stop on the Puntiagudo trek. There are hot springs 4km from here.

Name: Refugio El Chileno
Description: Refugio El Chileno lies in Valle Ascencio in Torres del Paine, on the route of the popular W Trek. It is a place to stay on the trail that leads to the base of the Las Torres mountains, with showers, a restaurant and a small shop.
Description (with html): Refugio El Chileno lies in Valle Ascencio in Torres del Paine, on the route of the popular W Trek. It is a place to stay on the trail that leads to the base of the Las Torres mountains, with showers, a restaurant and a small shop.

Name: Refugio Frey
Description: Refugio Frey is a mountain hut on the shore of Laguna Tonchek in Nahuel Huapi Naitonal Park. You can stay here on the first night of a four day hut-to-hut hike through the mountains.
Description (with html): Refugio Frey is a mountain hut on the shore of Laguna Tonchek in Nahuel Huapi Naitonal Park. You can stay here on the first night of a four day hut-to-hut hike through the mountains.

Name: Refugio Grey
Description: One of the newest refugios, Refugio Grey is a traditional hiker's hut and is nestled amongst the trees on the shores of Lake Grey, a short walk from the Glacier Grey lookout point. It has 60 beds in dormitories, with up to eight beds each. Rooms are small and basic, but certainly do the job in providing a warm and friendly sanctuary.
Description (with html): One of the newest refugios, Refugio Grey is a traditional hiker's hut and is nestled amongst the trees on the shores of Lake Grey, a short walk from the Glacier Grey lookout point. It has 60 beds in dormitories, with up to eight beds each. Rooms are small and basic, but certainly do the job in providing a warm and friendly sanctuary.

Name: Refugio Italia
Description: Also know as Refugio Laguna Negra, this is a mountain hut on the shore of the lake of the same name. You can stay here on the third night of a four day hut-to-hut hike through the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park.
Description (with html): Also know as Refugio Laguna Negra, this is a mountain hut on the shore of the lake of the same name. You can stay here on the third night of a four day hut-to-hut hike through the mountains of Nahuel Huapi National Park.

Name: Refugio Laguna Amarga
Description: This refugio lies on Rio Paine, close to Laguna Amarga in the East of Torres del Paine National Park. Away from the most popular trekking route in the park, this is a smaller refugio in a relatively quiet area. The facilities include shared bathrooms, a restaurant and a traditional 'quincho' grill area. Laguna Amarga is best for Puma Tracking in Torres del Paine. Read our guide to puma tracking in Torres del Paine
Description (with html):

Name: Refugio Las Torres
Description: An alternative to a tent or expensive hotel at the start of the W circuit in Torres del Paine, Refugio Las Torres offers 60 beds made up with bed linen. Facilities include a shop, relaxation room, bar and canteen.
Description (with html): An alternative to a tent or expensive hotel at the start of the W circuit in Torres del Paine, Refugio Las Torres offers 60 beds made up with bed linen. Facilities include a shop, relaxation room, bar and canteen.

Name: Refugio Lopez
Description: Refugio Lopez is a mountain hut in Nahuel Huapi Naitonal Park which provides accommodation for those trekking through the mountains.
Description (with html): Refugio Lopez is a mountain hut in Nahuel Huapi Naitonal Park which provides accommodation for those trekking through the mountains.

Name: Refugio Los Cuernos
Description: This refugio is beside Lago Nordenskjold in Torres del Paine National Park and it lies on the route of the W Trek not far from the French Valley. It is relatively small with just 36 beds, making it one of the most sociable refugios in the park. In addition there are private cabins away from the main building beside a waterfall. The refugio has a restaurant, shop and shared bathrooms.
Description (with html): This refugio is beside Lago Nordenskjold in Torres del Paine National Park and it lies on the route of the W Trek not far from the French Valley. It is relatively small with just 36 beds, making it one of the most sociable refugios in the park. In addition there are private cabins away from the main building beside a waterfall. The refugio has a restaurant, shop and shared bathrooms.

Name: Refugio Otto Meiling
Description: Refugio Otto Meiling sits between two glaciers, high on Mount Tronador, and provides shelter for those trekking on the mountain. Otto Meiling was a German-born mountaineer who achieved many first ascents in this region, including several peaks in Nahuel Huapi National Park. He built this hut in the 1950s on Mount Tronador, which he summitted 15 times, and it was later renamed after him.
Description (with html): Refugio Otto Meiling sits between two glaciers, high on Mount Tronador, and provides shelter for those trekking on the mountain. Otto Meiling was a German-born mountaineer who achieved many first ascents in this region, including several peaks in Nahuel Huapi National Park. He built this hut in the 1950s on Mount Tronador, which he summitted 15 times, and it was later renamed after him.

Name: Refugio Paine Grande
Description: Refugio Paine Grande is the largest refugio on the route of the W Trek, with good-sized rooms for 100 trekkers. This refugio lies on the shore of Lago Pehoe offering great views of the lake as well as the Paine Grande mountains, which can be enjoyed from the bar. Decent portions of good food are served in the canteen and there are also lounge areas, shower rooms, a shop and even computers with internet access.
Description (with html): Refugio Paine Grande is the largest refugio on the route of the W Trek, with good-sized rooms for 100 trekkers. This refugio lies on the shore of Lago Pehoe offering great views of the lake as well as the Paine Grande mountains, which can be enjoyed from the bar. Decent portions of good food are served in the canteen and there are also lounge areas, shower rooms, a shop and even computers with internet access.

Name: Refugio Puesto Cagliero
Description: The Refugio Puesto Cagliero is located in the Reserva Los Huemules in Argentina. It is next to Lago del Diablo and is used as an overnight stop on the way to ice trekking tips on Glacier Cagliero.
Description (with html): The Refugio Puesto Cagliero is located in the Reserva Los Huemules in Argentina. It is next to Lago del Diablo and is used as an overnight stop on the way to ice trekking tips on Glacier Cagliero.

Name: Refugio Quetrus
Description: Trek here from Tagua Tagua Lake and stay overnight.
Description (with html): Trek here from Tagua Tagua Lake and stay overnight.

Name: Refugio San Martin
Description: Also known as Refugio Jakob, this is a mountain hut beside Laguna Jakob in Nahuel Huapi National Park. You can spend the night here on the second day of a 4 day hut-to-hut hike through the mountains.
Description (with html): Also known as Refugio Jakob, this is a mountain hut beside Laguna Jakob in Nahuel Huapi National Park. You can spend the night here on the second day of a 4 day hut-to-hut hike through the mountains.

Name: Reloncaví Estuary
Description: The Reloncavi Sound is the body of water south of Puerto Montt.
Description (with html): The Reloncavi Sound is the body of water south of Puerto Montt.

Name: Reloncaví Fjord
Description: Reloncaví Fjord is located in the Chilean Lake District and is visited on a sea kayaking trip from Puerto Varas. A wide variety of wildlife inhabits the fjord including sea lions, dolphins, pelicans and penguins.
Description (with html): Reloncaví Fjord is located in the Chilean Lake District and is visited on a sea kayaking trip from Puerto Varas. A wide variety of wildlife inhabits the fjord including sea lions, dolphins, pelicans and penguins.

Name: Reserva Los Huemules
Description: The Reserva Los Huemules is located in Argentina and is committed to the conservation of both cultural heritage and wildlife. It is home to torrent duck, Magellanic woodpecker, condor, huemul, red fox and puma.
Description (with html): The Reserva Los Huemules is located in Argentina and is committed to the conservation of both cultural heritage and wildlife. It is home to torrent duck, Magellanic woodpecker, condor, huemul, red fox and puma.

Name: Rio Alumine
Description: The Alumine river is home to Brown and Rainbow trout, which can be fished by both wet and dry fly fishing. The lower part of this river runs past Estancia Huechahue, a fly-fishing and riding lodge which offers its guests guides and equipment.
Description (with html): The Alumine river is home to Brown and Rainbow trout, which can be fished by both wet and dry fly fishing. The lower part of this river runs past Estancia Huechahue, a fly-fishing and riding lodge which offers its guests guides and equipment.

Name: Rio Blanco
Description: The source of Rio Blanco is Laguna Sucia, which collects water that has been fed into Laguna de los Tres by its glacier. The river eventually joins Rio Electrico and it is possible to trek along Rio Blanco from the Rio Electrico Bridge. You can also trek beside this river on the day trek to the famous viewpoint at Laguna de los Tres from El Chalten, and it flows between two Fitz Roy base camps: Campos Rio Blanco and Poincenot.
Description (with html): The source of Rio Blanco is Laguna Sucia, which collects water that has been fed into Laguna de los Tres by its glacier. The river eventually joins Rio Electrico and it is possible to trek along Rio Blanco from the Rio Electrico Bridge. You can also trek beside this river on the day trek to the famous viewpoint at Laguna de los Tres from El Chalten, and it flows between two Fitz Roy base camps: Campos Rio Blanco and Poincenot.

Name: Rio Bravo
Description: Rio Bravo serves as a compulsory crossing when driving the Carretera Austral from Puerto Yungay to Villa O'Higgins.
Description (with html): Rio Bravo serves as a compulsory crossing when driving the Carretera Austral from Puerto Yungay to Villa O'Higgins.

Name: Río Chico Camp
Description: River Chico Camp is located at the top of the Río Chico Valley. It is used as a base camp from which to trek to nearby valleys, viewpoints and lagoons.
Description (with html): River Chico Camp is located at the top of the Río Chico Valley. It is used as a base camp from which to trek to nearby valleys, viewpoints and lagoons.

Name: Rio Chimehuin
Description: Running past the small town of Junin de los Andes, Rio Chimehuin is the river which gave northern Patagonia its reputation as one of the world's top fly fishing destinations. You can fish the river's Brown and Rainbow trout from drift boats or by wading out into the water, and the clear waters allow for a wide range of techniques. Rio Chimehuin is easily accessible from the nearby Estancia Huechahue.
Description (with html): Running past the small town of Junin de los Andes, Rio Chimehuin is the river which gave northern Patagonia its reputation as one of the world's top fly fishing destinations. You can fish the river's Brown and Rainbow trout from drift boats or by wading out into the water, and the clear waters allow for a wide range of techniques. Rio Chimehuin is easily accessible from the nearby Estancia Huechahue.

Name: Rio Collon Cura
Description: You can take advantage of the large numbers of both Brown and Rainbow trout in the Collon Cura by float fishing. Beside the upper part of the river lies Estancia Huechahue, a fly-fishing and riding lodge which can provide fishing equipment adn guides for its guests.
Description (with html): You can take advantage of the large numbers of both Brown and Rainbow trout in the Collon Cura by float fishing. Beside the upper part of the river lies Estancia Huechahue, a fly-fishing and riding lodge which can provide fishing equipment adn guides for its guests.

Name: Rio de Janeiro
Description: Rio de Janeiro is a major coastal city in Brazil, famous for its breathtaking natural setting, iconic landmarks like Christ the Redeemer and Sugarloaf Mountain, and vibrant culture, including its world-famous Carnival festival and beautiful beaches like Copacabana and Ipanema.
Description (with html): Rio de Janeiro is a major coastal city in Brazil, famous for its breathtaking natural setting, iconic landmarks like Christ the Redeemer and Sugarloaf Mountain, and vibrant culture, including its world-famous Carnival festival and beautiful beaches like Copacabana and Ipanema.

Name: Rio de las Vueltas
Description: This river winds down from the Argentinian Lake District into Lago Viedma, and is a fantastic location for kayaking, with a backdrop of forests and glaciers.
Description (with html): This river winds down from the Argentinian Lake District into Lago Viedma, and is a fantastic location for kayaking, with a backdrop of forests and glaciers.

Name: Rio Electrico Bridge
Description: Around 20km north of El Chalten this is normally the drop-off point for people heading to Piedra del Fraile and the Marconi Pass. A transfer out from Chalten will take around 30 minutes and cost £10 to £20.
Description (with html):
Around 20km north of El Chalten this is normally the drop-off point for people heading to Piedra del Fraile and the Marconi Pass.

A transfer out from Chalten will take around 30 minutes and cost £10 to £20.

Name: Rio Fitz Roy (Cerro Dos Condores)
Description: Found in the northern part of Los Glaciares National Park, the Fitz Roy River is a popular location from which to begin hikes to some of the park's main highlights including Cerro Torre. The Fitz Roy river flows through a beautiful glacial valley and through the town of El Chalten, which is the base for many people hiking in the park.
Description (with html):
Found in the northern part of Los Glaciares National Park, the Fitz Roy River is a popular location from which to begin hikes to some of the park's main highlights including Cerro Torre.

↵

Name: Rio Futaleufu
Description: Nearby the town with the same name in the Chilean Lake District, this fast-flowing river is the site of the yearly Futafest, a competition held by local white water rafting companies in the Chilean Lake District with kayaking & rafting races. It's a top spot for white water rafters from all over the world, and it's not hard to see why as rafting this river's waters is an exciting challenge. Furthermore, the river's surroundings make it a lovely place to visit even if you don't plan to white water raft. You'll find forests, mountains and lakes nearby, and if you do choose to kayak or white water raft with a local operator, you'll stay at a riverside adventure camp where you can relax in a hot tub or enjoy horse riding & trekking too. Other popular rivers for white water rafting include the Rio Manso over the border near Bariloche. Similarly to the Futaleufu it's fast-flowing currents attract thrill seekers, and it's split into 3 sections according to levels of difficulty.
Description (with html):

Name: Rio Gallegos
Description: Rio Gallegos is the Capital of the Province of Santa Cruz in Argentina and is found on the atlantic coast. Its has a nearby airport which supports 3-4 flights a day from Buenos Aires. This is not much of a tourist town however, it is mainly a hub for coal-shipping and wool production. Most people who visit Rio Gallegos will be passing through en route to El Calafate (5 and a half hours away), Puerto Natales (3 and a half hours away) or Ushuaia (7 and a half hours away).
Description (with html):

Name: Rio Gallegos Airport (RGL)
Description: Rio Gallegos is a small town on the Atlantic coast in Santa Cruz province with 3 to 4 flights per day from Buenos Aeres. Approximately 3 and a half hours from Puerto Natales and 5 and a half from El Calafate.
Description (with html): Rio Gallegos is a small town on the Atlantic coast in Santa Cruz province with 3 to 4 flights per day from Buenos Aeres. Approximately 3 and a half hours from Puerto Natales and 5 and a half from El Calafate.

Name: Rio Grande
Description: River in San Pedro de Atacama.
Description (with html): River in San Pedro de Atacama.

Name: Rio Grande
Description: Río Grande is a city in Argentina, on the north coast of the eastern part of the Isla Grande de Tierra del Fuego.
Description (with html): River in San Pedro de Atacama.

Name: Rio Ibanez
Description: A major contributory into the Lago General Carrera, the source of the Rio Ibanez lies somewhere amid the foothills of the Hudson Volcano, just north of the North Patagonian Ice Cap. Running past Cerro Castillo national Park, it flows all the way to Puerto Ibanez on the northern shore of the Lago General Carrera.
Description (with html): A major contributory into the Lago General Carrera, the source of the Rio Ibanez lies somewhere amid the foothills of the Hudson Volcano, just north of the North Patagonian Ice Cap. Running past Cerro Castillo national Park, it flows all the way to Puerto Ibanez on the northern shore of the Lago General Carrera.

Name: Rio Malleo
Description: The Malleo is famous among anglers as one of the best spots in Patagonia for fishing the region's trout. Wading is the best way to reach the fish here, and this river is perfect for dry fly fishing. The river is easily accessible from the nearby Estancia Huechahue, a fishing and riding lodge which can provide its guests with equipment and guides.
Description (with html): The Malleo is famous among anglers as one of the best spots in Patagonia for fishing the region's trout. Wading is the best way to reach the fish here, and this river is perfect for dry fly fishing. The river is easily accessible from the nearby Estancia Huechahue, a fishing and riding lodge which can provide its guests with equipment and guides.

Name: Rio Manso
Description: Rio Manso is a beautiful river in a wonderful setting, and its fast and furious rapids make it a great place for whitewater rafting. Rafting trips here can range from one day on the water to week-long trips, staying at lodges and campsites.
Description (with html): Rio Manso is a beautiful river in a wonderful setting, and its fast and furious rapids make it a great place for whitewater rafting. Rafting trips here can range from one day on the water to week-long trips, staying at lodges and campsites.

Name: Rio Manso Fishing Lodge
Description: Here you can take part in varied types of fishing on the Rio Manso and Lago Hess. This fishing lodge offers comfortable accommodation in 9 rooms with spectacular views of the lake and surrounding mountains.
Description (with html): Here you can take part in varied types of fishing on the Rio Manso and Lago Hess. This fishing lodge offers comfortable accommodation in 9 rooms with spectacular views of the lake and surrounding mountains.
NEW CUSTOM ADDRESS/WHAT3WORDS: Lago Hess 8400, R8400 Bariloche, Río Negro, Argentina

Name: Rio Murta
Description: Feeding into the Lago General Carrera's northwestern tip, the Carretera Austral follows its course on its approach to the Lake.
Description (with html): Feeding into the Lago General Carrera's northwestern tip, the Carretera Austral follows its course on its approach to the Lake.

Name: Rio Neff Falls
Description: At the confluence where the Rio Neff and Rio Baker meet.
Description (with html): At the confluence where the Rio Neff and Rio Baker meet.

Name: Río Negro
Description: The Río Negro river is a significant waterway in Argentine Patagonia, whose headwaters (the Limay and Neuquén rivers) converge within Neuquén Province before the Río Negro itself flows eastward through the province of the same name to the Atlantic Ocean. This river system is crucial for irrigation, hydroelectricity, and supports fertile agricultural valleys, particularly known for fruit production.
Description (with html): The Río Negro river is a significant waterway in Argentine Patagonia, whose headwaters (the Limay and Neuquén rivers) converge within Neuquén Province before the Río Negro itself flows eastward through the province of the same name to the Atlantic Ocean. This river system is crucial for irrigation, hydroelectricity, and supports fertile agricultural valleys, particularly known for fruit production.

Name: Rio Palena
Description: The mighty Palena extends from the pampas all the way to the Pacific, providing a fascinating way of exploring the hugely contrasting environments of Patagonia. it is navigable along its whole length, running past Alto Palena, La Junta, and Raul marin Balmaceda. The river was in 2010 declared a freshwater reserve, home to some outstanding salmon. The section from La Junta to Raul Marin was declared in 2009 a Heritage Route by the Ministry of National Properties. Popular activities here include white-water rafting, kayaking and canoeing, as well as fishing.
Description (with html): The mighty Palena extends from the pampas all the way to the Pacific, providing a fascinating way of exploring the hugely contrasting environments of Patagonia. it is navigable along its whole length, running past Alto Palena, La Junta, and Raul marin Balmaceda. Popular activities here include white-water rafting, kayaking and canoeing, as well as fishing.

Name: Rio Puelo
Description: This choppy river starts in Argentina and flows across the border into Lago Tagua Tagua some 17 miles from Cochamo in the Chilean Lake District. It then flows all the way east to the Reloncavi Estuary. A great location for kayaking and horse riding, the terrain is mountainous and green, perfect for growing grapes, and the whole area has a mediterranean feel when the sun is shining.

Name: Rio Quilquihue
Description: A tributary of the famous Rio Chimehuin, Quilquihue is a smaller river offering dry fly fishing opportunities. This river can be accessed from Estancia Huechahue, a nearby lodge which can provide its guests with equipment and guides.
Description (with html): A tributary of the famous Rio Chimehuin, Quilquihue is a smaller river offering dry fly fishing opportunities. This river can be accessed from Estancia Huechahue, a nearby lodge which can provide its guests with equipment and guides.

Name: Rio Serrano
Description: The source of the Rio Serrano lies in Torres del Paine National Park. It flows into the Bernardo O'Higgins national park, joining the Seno Última Esperanza at Puerto Toro. Kayaking down the Rio Serrano is a wonderful experience and for the lucky few a fitting finale to a few days of hiking. Some people choose to enter the national park via the Rio Serrano, taking a Zodiac boat down the river. One example is this 14 day trek in Torres del Paine. Also, the Serrano River is a great area for fly fishing, in the shadow of the Paine Massif. The most common fish here is the Brown trout, but you can also find some Rainbow trout and the huge Chinook Salmon, all of which can be fished by wading into the river.

Name: Río Serrano Hotel + Spa
Description: Río Serrano Hotel + Spa is a hotel located on the Serrano River just outside the southern entrance of Torres del Paine National Park in Chilean Patagonia. It is known for its spectacular panoramic views of the Paine Massif and its location as a base for exploring the park's iconic sights.
Description (with html): Río Serrano Hotel + Spa is a hotel located on the Serrano River just outside the southern entrance of Torres del Paine National Park in Chilean Patagonia. It is known for its spectacular panoramic views of the Paine Massif and its location as a base for exploring the park's iconic sights.

Name: Rio Simpson
Description: Río Simpson is a river in the Aysén Region of Chilean Patagonia, known for its pristine waters and beautiful canyon landscapes. It is a popular destination for fly-fishing, rafting, and other aquatic sports, and flows through the Río Simpson National Reserve.
Description (with html): Río Simpson is a river in the Aysén Region of Chilean Patagonia, known for its pristine waters and beautiful canyon landscapes. It is a popular destination for fly-fishing, rafting, and other aquatic sports, and flows through the Río Simpson National Reserve.

Name: Rio Traful
Description: The Traful is an exclusively catch and release fly-fishing river, home to rainbow and brown trout and land-locked salmon. Some sections of the riverbank are lined with trees and shrubs. The river runs high and fast at the beginning of the season, with the level usually dropping in December but still having fast water until mid-January; it then runs slow until the first rains of the Autumn.
Description (with html): The Traful is an exclusively catch and release fly-fishing river, home to rainbow and brown trout and land-locked salmon. Some sections of the riverbank are lined with trees and shrubs. The river runs high and fast at the beginning of the season, with the level usually dropping in December  but still having fast water until mid-January; it then runs slow until the first rains of the Autumn.

Name: Río Trancura
Description: The Trancura River is located east of Pucón and is a popular destination for rafting. There are both Class 4 and 5 rapids on this river.
Description (with html): The Trancura River is located east of Pucón and is a popular destination for rafting. There are both Class 4 and 5 rapids on this river.

Name: Rio Tunel
Description: Rio Tunel flows down from Glaciars Rio Tunel Superior and Inferior and out into Bahia Tunel on the North West corner of Lago Viedma. You can trek beside the river on the Huemul Circuit, which is a multi-day trek starting and ending in El chalten.
Description (with html): Rio Tunel flows down from Glaciars Rio Tunel Superior and Inferior and out into Bahia Tunel on the North West corner of Lago Viedma. You can trek beside the river on the Huemul Circuit, which is a multi-day trek starting and ending in El chalten.

Name: Rio Turbio
Description: A small River in Cerro Castillo National Reserve, in the Aysen region of Chile.
Description (with html): A small River in Cerro Castillo National Reserve, in the Aysen region of Chile.

Name: Robinson Crusoe Lodge
Description: Robinson Crusoe Lodge gives you the opportunity to explore the pristine, undiscovered area of Villa o'Higgins, north of Torres del Paine. You can choose from one of their 3 programmes: trekking new trails which weren't around a couple of years ago, ice hiking over secluded glaciers and sailing across lakes in a region as yet undiscovered by tourists. Robinson Crusoe's motto, 'return to freedom', allows you to do just that in a small group of like minded people, in a relaxed atmosphere.
Description (with html): Robinson Crusoe Lodge gives you the opportunity to explore the pristine, undiscovered area of Villa o'Higgins, north of Torres del Paine. You can choose from one of their 3 programmes: trekking new trails which weren't around a couple of years ago, ice hiking over secluded glaciers and sailing across lakes in a region as yet undiscovered by tourists. Robinson Crusoe's motto, 'return to freedom', allows you to do just that in a small group of like minded people, in a relaxed atmosphere.

Name: Rock climbing school
Description: The rock climbing school is located just north of El Chaltén town. The El Chaltén area is one of the best in the world for rock climbing.
Description (with html): The rock climbing school is located just north of El Chaltén town. The El Chaltén area is one of the best in the world for rock climbing.

Name: Rupanco Lake
Description: A large picturesque lake close to the town of Osorno in Chilean Patagonia just outside the boundaries of Vicente Perez Rosales national park.
Description (with html): A large picturesque lake close to the town of Osorno in Chilean Patagonia just outside the boundaries of Vicente Perez Rosales national park.

Name: Rupert Island
Description: Rupert Island is a small island in the Magellan Straits and is home to a variety of wildlife, including penguins, skuas, cormorants, fur seals and sea lions.
Description (with html): Rupert Island is a small island in the Magellan Straits and is home to a variety of wildlife, including penguins, skuas, cormorants, fur seals and sea lions.

Name: Salar de Atacama
Description: Salar de Atacama is the largest salt flat in Chile, located in the heart of the Atacama Desert. This vast, shimmering white landscape is famous for its surreal appearance, highly saline lagoons like Laguna Chaxa and Laguna Cejar where you can float effortlessly, and as a critical habitat for various species of flamingos.
Description (with html):
↵↵↵↵↵↵
Atacama Salt Flat

Name: Salta
Description: Salta is a delightful vibrant city in northern Argentina. Driving out from Salta gives you a great opportunity to explore the surrounding region on some stunning roads, leading you through the mountains of wondrous shades, valleys overflowing with cacti, and colonial towns of Cafayate and the Cachi. Along the way you can hike trails through oasis valleys and vineyards, where you'll be able to taste the local wines, and sleep in charming traditional manor houses surrounded by dramatic scenery.
Description (with html): Salta is a delightful vibrant city in northern Argentina. Driving out from Salta gives you a great opportunity to explore the surrounding region on some stunning roads, leading you through the mountains of wondrous shades, valleys overflowing with cacti, and colonial towns of Cafayate and the Cachi. Along the way you can hike trails through oasis valleys and vineyards, where you'll be able to taste the local wines, and sleep in charming traditional manor houses surrounded by dramatic scenery.

Name: Salto Chico
Description: Salto Chico is a waterfall, beside which sits the luxurious Salto Chico Hotel, known as the Explora Patagonia. The waterfall has a much bigger counterpart called Salto Grande nearby.
Description (with html):
Salto Chico is a waterfall, beside which sits the luxurious Salto Chico Hotel, known as the Explora Patagonia.

↵

The waterfall has a much bigger counterpart called Salto Grande nearby.

Name: Salto del Laja
Description: The Saltos del Laja are huge waterfalls based in the north of Patagonia which stand at some 40 y 55 metres high. They can be found 16 miles north of the City of Los Angeles in the Bio Bio region of Chile. This waterfall and its surroundings are really beautiful and a great place to visit particularly if you're travelling along the Ruta 5 (Panamerican highway).
Description (with html):

Name: Salto Grande
Description: This beautiful waterfall can be found in the heart of Torres del Paine National Park, where the water from the turquoise Lake Nordenskjold flows through to Lake Pehoe. This impressive cascade is one of the more unusual highlights to see in the park, and few people actually visit it.
Description (with html):

Name: San Isidro
Description: San Isidro is a town in Greater Buenos Aires. It is located 28km from the city centre and is the city’s most affluent neighbourhood. The centre of San Isidro is a historic area with cobbled streets and single-storey houses. At the heart of Plaza Mitre is the neo-gothic San Isidro Cathedral, built in 1898.
Description (with html): San Isidro is a town in Greater Buenos Aires. It is located 28km from the city centre and is the city’s most affluent neighbourhood. The centre of San Isidro is a historic area with cobbled streets and single-storey houses. At the heart of Plaza Mitre is the neo-gothic San Isidro Cathedral, built in 1898.

Name: San Juan Bay
Description: San Juan Bay (Bahía San Juan) is a historical coastal area on the Brunswick Peninsula in Chilean Patagonia. It is notable as the location of significant early Chilean settlement attempts, including the ruins of Fuerte Bulnes and Puerto Hambre, situated along the Strait of Magellan.
Description (with html): San Juan Bay (Bahía San Juan) is a historical coastal area on the Brunswick Peninsula in Chilean Patagonia. It is notable as the location of significant early Chilean settlement attempts, including the ruins of Fuerte Bulnes and Puerto Hambre, situated along the Strait of Magellan.

Name: San Martin de los Andes
Description: San Martin de Los Andes is a great base for hiking, mountain biking and horse riding in Northern Patagonia. It's easily accessed from Bariloche. It sits on the eastern shore of Lago Lacar.
Description (with html): San Martin de Los Andes is a great base for hiking, mountain biking and horse riding in Northern Patagonia. It's easily accessed from Bariloche. It sits on the eastern shore of Lago Lacar.

Name: San Pedro de Atacama
Description: San Pedro is the gateway to the Atacama Desert and its only significant town for visitors. It sits on a plateau at 2,400m above sea level but the Andes rise up to over 6,000m within a few kilometres of the town creating a wonderful backdrop. It is a single storey adobe town with dirt roads. A good range of acccommodation options some great places to eat many of which are set around a central courtyard with an open fire.
Description (with html): San Pedro is the gateway to the Atacama Desert and its only significant town for visitors. Name: Santa Cruz
Description: This is a charming town in the Colchagua Valley of Central Chile, widely known as the heart of Chile's premier wine region and a popular base for visiting numerous world-class wineries.

↵↵↵↵↵↵
Santa Cruz

Name: Santiago
Description: Santiago is the capital of Chile and the gateway to Chilean Patagonia's mountain peaks, glacial valleys, and coastal fjords. International visitors to Chile will fly into Santiago airport and may wish to spend some time in the capital or in the nearby port city of Valparaiso. A guided or unguided walking tour is the perfect way to explore Santiago's historical and cultural landmarks in an afternoon. Find out what to do in Santiago.
Description (with html):
Santiago is the capital of Chile and the gateway to Chilean Patagonia's mountain peaks, glacial valleys, and coastal fjords. International visitors to Chile will fly into Santiago airport and may wish to spend some time in the capital or in the nearby port city of  Valparaiso. A guided or unguided walking tour is the perfect way to explore Santiago's historical and cultural landmarks in an afternoon.

Name: Santiago Airport (SCL)
Description: Santiago airport (SCL) is Chile's biggest international airport and the access point for any trip to Chilean Patagonia. The airport is located between the beautiful port city of Valparaiso and the city of Santiago itself.
Description (with html): Santiago airport (SCL) is Chile's biggest international airport and the access point for any trip to Chilean Patagonia. The airport is located between the beautiful port city of Valparaiso and the city of Santiago itself.
NEW CUSTOM ADDRESS/WHAT3WORDS: Av. Armando Cortínez Ote. 1704, Pudahuel, Región Metropolitana, Chile

Name: Sauzal
Description: Sauzal is a small village and wine region in the Maule Valley of Central Chile, known for its traditional, small-scale producers who make high-quality wines from old vineyards.
Description (with html): Sauzal is a small village and wine region in the Maule Valley of Central Chile, known for its traditional, small-scale producers who make high-quality wines from old vineyards.

Name: Seno Moyano
Description: The Seno Moyano, or Moyano Sound, branches off from Lago Viedma and is located in the Los Glaciares National Park.
Description (with html): The Seno Moyano, or Moyano Sound, branches off from Lago Viedma and is located in the Los Glaciares National Park.

Name: Seno Otway Penguin Reserve
Description: Close to Punta Arenas, Seno Otway is a fantastic place to see a Patagonian penguin colony, which makes its home here each year from October to March.
Description (with html): Close to Punta Arenas, Seno Otway is a fantastic place to see a Patagonian penguin colony, which makes its home here each year from October to March.

Name: Seno Última Esperanza (Last Hope Sound)
Description: Seno Última Esperanza gets its name from Captain Juan de Ladrillero, who in 1557 went searching for the western entrance to the Strait of Magellan. After several weeks of searching, and in desperate need of food and water, he eventually found this fjord and was able to stock up on provisions in what is now Puerto Natales. Out of his joy at finding what he thought was the Strait, he named the fjord 'Seno Última Esperanza' or 'Sound of Last Hope'. A fun way to explore this fjord is by catching the ferry from Glaciar Serrano, just on the border of Torres del Paine National Park, down the Serrano river. On its way back to Puerto Natales, the ferry stops at Estancia Perales for you to enjoy a delicious lamb asado, before you continue on for the 2-hour journey back to Puerto Natales harbour. A handful of operators offer kayaking trips in the Seno Ultima Esperanza. This is a peaceful location where you can paddle up to a waterfall and camp out on the fjord's green banks.

Name: Serrano Camp
Description: Serrano Camp is a designated camping area located near the Serrano River and the southern entrance of Torres del Paine National Park in Chilean Patagonia. It serves as a popular and convenient base for trekkers and visitors exploring the park's iconic trails and landscapes.
Description (with html): Serrano Camp is a designated camping area located near the Serrano River and the southern entrance of Torres del Paine National Park in Chilean Patagonia. It serves as a popular and convenient base for trekkers and visitors exploring the park's iconic trails and landscapes.

Name: Serrano Glacier
Description: The Serrano Glacier lies on the border of Patagonia's most popular destination and national park - Torres del Paine . The glacier descends steeply into a lagoon surrounded by pine trees and is easily accessed with a 5-10 minute walk from the small pier and campsite near Puerto Toro.
Description (with html): The Serrano Glacier lies on the border of Patagonia's most popular destination and national park - Torres del Paine. The glacier descends steeply into a lagoon surrounded by pine trees and is easily accessed with a 5-10 minute walk from the small pier and campsite near Puerto Toro.

Name: Sierra Dorotea Hill
Description: Sierra Dorotea Hill (also known as Cerro Dorotea) is a prominent hill located just outside Puerto Natales in Chilean Patagonia. It offers incredible panoramic views of the city, the Ultima Esperanza Fjord, and a vast expanse of the Patagonian steppe, making it a popular spot for short hikes, horseback riding, or 4x4 tours to enjoy the scenery.
Description (with html): Sierra Dorotea Hill

Name: Sloggett Bay
Description: Sloggett Bay is located on the Mitre Peninsula in Tierra del Fuego. On the beach there is a large, disused gold dredger, last used in the early 1900s.
Description (with html): Sloggett Bay is located on the Mitre Peninsula in Tierra del Fuego. On the beach there is a large, disused gold dredger, last used in the early 1900s.

Name: Socaire
Description: Socaire is a village on Route 23, south of San Pedro de Atacama. It is famous for its agricultural terraces and vast mountain views.
Description (with html): Socaire is a village on Route 23, south of San Pedro de Atacama. It is famous for its agricultural terraces and vast mountain views.

Name: Sollipulli volcano
Description: Sollipulli volcano is an active stratovolcano located in the Araucanía Region of the Chilean Andes, notably distinguished by its large, ice-filled caldera. This unique feature makes it a challenging and rewarding destination for trekkers and mountaineers seeking a remote Patagonian adventure. 2,282 m (7,487 ft).

Name: South Shetland Islands
Description: The South Shetland Islands are a group of 20 islands and islets that were first reached in February 1819. The Islands are also the first piece of land after crossing the Drake Passage from Patagonia and before reaching Antarctica. The Islands are teaming with wildlife and are a must-see for anyone travelling on an Antarctic cruise. Here you can expect to see huge penguin rookeries and beaches teaming with seals. On King George Island, you can see cute Adélie and Chinstrap Penguins, as well as Kelp Gulls, Blue-eyed Cormorants, Antarctic Terns and Southern Giant Petrels. This is also where the Chilean and Argentinian goverments have their research bases.
Description (with html):

Name: Spegazzini Glacier
Description: Whilst not the biggest of the major glaciers in Los Glaciares National Park, Spegazzini Glacier is a hugely impressive sight, if for no other reason than the sheer size of its wall, which can tower as high as 135 metres (440 feet). Where is it? Glaciar Sepgazzini sits on Lago Argentino, close to other major glacial sights in Los Glaciares such as Perito Moreno and Glaciar Upsala The closest main town is El Chalten - a small hikers' haven nestled amid the mountains, in the shadow of Mount Fitz Roy How to see it: Accessible only by boat, you can see this glacier along with several others by weaving between the moving icebergs of Lago Argentino The area is served by El Calafate's hotels and airport, and by the various places to stay in El Chalten Find out more about Patagonia's glaciers.

Name: Start of Lanín Volcano trek
Description: Start the trek to the summit of Lanín Volcano by the Forest Rangers Office at the volcano's base.
Description (with html): Start the trek to the summit of Lanín Volcano by the Forest Rangers Office at the volcano's base.

Name: Tamango National Park
Description: Tamango National Park is a protected area in the Aysén Region of Chilean Patagonia, primarily known as a crucial habitat for the endangered Huemul (Andean deer). The park offers diverse landscapes ranging from Patagonian steppe to lenga forests, providing excellent opportunities for trekking and wildlife observation near the town of Cochrane.
Description (with html): Tamango National Park

Name: Temuco
Description: The capital city of Chile’s Araucanía region, Temuco is an important gateway to both the Chilean Lake District and the adventure capital of Pucón, as well as being the main access point for Conguíllo National Park. For Chileans it’s known best as the city where their national poet Pablo Neruda grew up and had some of his earliest poetry published. Temuco was founded in 1881 in the heartlands of Mapuche territory. It’s complicated colonial history is on display in the city’s Plaza de Armas Aníbal Pinto , named for the president who ordered the town’s creation. In the plaza’s centre stands a massive statue called Homenaje a la Regíon de la Araucanía (Tribute to the Araucanía Region), which shows a female Mapuche shaman with a raised drum on a rocky plinth surrounded on four sides by the Mapuche leader Kallfulifan, the conquistador-poet Alonso de Ercilla, a soldier of the pacification and a modern colonist. The excellent Museo Regional de la Araucanía has a strong focus on Mapuche culture. On the northern edge of Temuco, the Monumento Natural Cerro Ñielol is a 90 hectare reserve of native forest, on the spot where Mapuche leaders ceded their territory to the colonists for the founding of the town. The city is a major transport hub. Temuco’s Araucanía Airport (code ZCO) is 21km south of the city. From here it’s around a 90 minute flight to Santiago. Connections to Puerto Montt are also routed through Santiago; there are no direct flights from Temuco. Pucón is 105km south of Temuco – about a 90 minute drive. There are direct long distance buses to most cities in Chile, as well services to Bariloche in Argentina.
Description (with html):
The capital city of Chile’s Araucanía region, Temuco is an important gateway to both the Chilean Lake District and the adventure capital of Pucón, as well as being the main access point for Conguíllo National Park. For Chileans it’s known best as the city where their national poet Pablo Neruda grew up and had some of his earliest poetry published. 

Temuco was founded in 1881 in the heartlands of Mapuche territory. It’s complicated colonial history is on display in the city’s Plaza de Armas Aníbal Pinto, named for the president who ordered the town’s creation. In the plaza’s centre stands a massive statue called Homenaje a la Regíon de la Araucanía (Tribute to the Araucanía Region), which shows a female Mapuche shaman with a raised drum on a rocky plinth surrounded on four sides by the Mapuche leader Kallfulifan, the conquistador-poet Alonso de Ercilla, a soldier of the pacification and a modern colonist. The excellent Museo Regional de la Araucanía has a strong focus on Mapuche culture. On the northern edge of Temuco, the Monumento Natural Cerro Ñielol is a 90 hectare reserve of native forest, on the spot where Mapuche leaders ceded their territory to the colonists for the founding of the town.

The city is a major transport hub. Temuco’s Araucanía Airport (code ZCO) is 21km south of the city. From here it’s around a 90 minute flight to Santiago. Connections to Puerto Montt are also routed through Santiago; there are no direct flights from Temuco.

Pucón is 105km south of Temuco – about a 90 minute drive. There are direct long distance buses to most cities in Chile, as well services to Bariloche in Argentina.

Name: Temuco Airport (ZCO)
Description: Access to the Volcano region of northern Chilean Patagonia, and the adventure town of Pucon.

Name: Tepuhueico Park
Description: Tepuhueico Park is located on the west on Chiloé Island and can be visited on a day trip from Castro. There are fantastic opportunities for hiking in the park and it's home to both pudu and Darwin's fox.
Description (with html): Tepuhueico Park is located on the west on Chiloé Island and can be visited on a day trip from Castro. There are fantastic opportunities for hiking in the park and it's home to both pudu and Darwin's fox.

Name: Termas de Quitralco
Description: These are hot springs in Quitralco Bay, which you can enjoy after cruising through Quitralco Fjord.
Description (with html): These are hot springs in Quitralco Bay, which you can enjoy after cruising through Quitralco Fjord.

Name: The Marble Caves
Description: The Capillas de Marmol (the Marble Caves), also known as Catedral de Marmol (the Marble Cathedral), is an inredible natural attraction that draws hundreds of visitors every year to the little town of Puerto Tranquilo (from where boats and kayaks can be rented with which to visit). Created by the erosive effect of the blue water of Lago General Carrera lapping at the stone, the Cathedral looks like a beautiful piece of sculpted artwork.
Description (with html): The Capillas de Marmol (the Marble Caves), also known as Catedral de Marmol (the Marble Cathedral), is an inredible natural attraction that draws hundreds of visitors every year to the little town of Puerto Tranquilo (from where boats and kayaks can be rented with which to visit). Created by the erosive effect of the blue water of Lago General Carrera lapping at the stone, the Cathedral looks like a beautiful piece of sculpted artwork.

Name: The Remota Hotel
Description: The Remota Hotel is located on the shore of Seno Ultima Esperanza, just outside of the small town of Puerto Natales, which lies on the edge of Torres del Paine National Park. The hotel, which occupies an old agricultural building, has comfortable rooms and stylish architecture. It is open all year round and offers a range of excursions into the national park. Find out more and check availability for the Remota Hotel.

Name: The Singular Hotel Patagonia
Description: The Singular is a luxury hotel in Puerto Bories, around a two hour drive from Torres del Paine National Park. Despite being quite a distance outside of this national park, the hotel does offer trekking trips to the famous trails of Torres del Paine. The hotel's all inclusive packages include a variety of excursions in the surrounding landscape, as well as comfortable rooms and suites with views of the Last Hope Sound, and meals in the Singular's unique restaurant. Find out more and check availability for The Singular Hotel.

Name: Tierra Patagonia
Description: Situated just outside Torres del Paine National Park to the East, Tierra Patagonia is a beautifully designed luxury hotel with stunning views over the park. The hotel provides excursions to all the main highlights of Torres del Paine, as well as the less visited sights that lie well off the beaten track, with experienced enthusiastic guides. Other offerings of the hotel include a spa, restaurant and open bar. >>> Find out more about Tierra Patagonia

Name: Tigre
Description: The town of Tigre is situated in the north of Greater Buenos Aires, 28km (17 miles) north of Buenos Aires city. Tigre lies on the Paraná Delta and is a tourist and weekend destination.
Description (with html): The town of Tigre is situated in the north of Greater Buenos Aires, 28km (17 miles) north of Buenos Aires city. Tigre lies on the Paraná Delta and is a tourist and weekend destination.

Name: Tipiliuke Lodge
Description: This luxurious lodge is located in the heart of a working cattle ranch in the Argentinian Lake District. Fly fishing is the main activity on offer here, but it is also possible to take part in horse riding and hiking. The lodge has excellent facilities and provides good quality food and drink, and with just 9 rooms in the lodge, you'll receive a very personalised service.
Description (with html): This luxurious lodge is located in the heart of a working cattle ranch in the Argentinian Lake District. Fly fishing is the main activity on offer here, but it is also possible to take part in horse riding and hiking. The lodge has excellent facilities and provides good quality food and drink, and with just 9 rooms in the lodge, you'll receive a very personalised service.

Name: Tolhuaca volcano
Description: Tolhuaca volcano is a stratovolcano located in the Andes Mountains of southern Chile, known for its steep, glacially-eroded slopes and for dominating the landscape views in the nearby Tolhuaca National Park. 2,806 m (9,206 ft)

Name: Tolhuin
Description: On the edge of Lago Fagnano in Argentine Tierra del Fuego.
Description (with html): On the edge of Lago Fagnano in Argentine Tierra del Fuego.

Name: Torre Egger
Description: Torre Egger sits between Cerros Torre and Standhardt in a four mountain chain, of which the highest peak is Cerro Torre.
Description (with html): Torre Egger sits between Cerros Torre and Standhardt in a four mountain chain, of which the highest peak is Cerro Torre.

Name: Torre Sur
Description: Torre Sur is the highest of Las Torres, the three granite spires from which Torres del Paine National Park takes its name. On the most popular trekking routes in the park you can hike to a stunning lookout point onto these peaks.
Description (with html): Torre Sur is the highest of Las Torres, the three granite spires from which Torres del Paine National Park takes its name. On the most popular trekking routes in the park you can hike to a stunning lookout point onto these peaks.

Name: Torres del Paine
Description: Torres del Paine is a world-famous national park in Chilean Patagonia, renowned for its dramatic granite peaks, massive glaciers, bright blue lakes, and abundant wildlife, offering some of the best multi-day trekking in the world.
Description (with html): Torres del Paine is a world-famous national park in Chilean Patagonia, renowned for its dramatic granite peaks, massive glaciers, bright blue lakes, and abundant wildlife, offering some of the best multi-day trekking in the world.

Name: Torres del Paine look-out (via Valle Ascensio)
Description: Trekking up Valle Ascencio to arrive at the Torres del Paine lookout is the highlight of the W Circuit or Full Circuit in Torres del Paine National park. Located at the East of the park, this viewpoint looks straight out onto the three granite 'torres' from which the park takes its name and beneath them, a still grey-blue lake.After having made the 2-hour journey by bus or private transfer into Torres del Paine National Park from Puerto Natales the day before, this day-trek up to the look-out (which is included in almost every operator's itinerary) starts from the base of Ascencio Valley, at Refugio Las Torres/Camping las Torres or Hotel Las Torres.The hike up to the look-out is considered by many as one of the most difficult days on the Full Circuit, alon g with Paso John Garner , as you ascend some 800 metres. It takes roughly 4 hours to reach the Torres del Paine viewpoint from the start of Valle Ascencio, a pretty windy place to trek in Patagonian summer so make sure to bring a windproof jacket if you're there between October to March. It's also important to bear in mind that the last 45 minutes up to the look-out are a steep uphill climb over rocks and sandy terrain, and many hikers take trekking poles to help their knees on the way back down. After trekking up to the look-out, hard-core climbers can continue up along Valle Silencio, past Campamento Japones and through dense rainforest for views of 'los Cuernos' mountains, Escudo (the Shield) and Fortaleza (the Fortress), as well as the back of the spectacular granite spires, Las Torres.
Description (with html):
Trekking up Valle Ascencio to arrive at the Torres del Paine lookout is the highlight of the W Circuit or Full Circuit in Torres del Paine National park. Located at the East of the park, this viewpoint looks straight out onto the three granite 'torres' from which the park takes its name and beneath them, a still grey-blue lake.

After having made the 2-hour journey by bus or private transfer into Torres del Paine National Park from Puerto Natales the day before, this day-trek up to the look-out (which is included in almost every operator's itinerary) starts from the base of Ascencio Valley, at Refugio Las Torres/Camping las Torres or Hotel Las Torres.

The hike up to the look-out is considered by many as one of the most difficult days on the Full Circuit, along with Paso John Garner, as you ascend some 800 metres. It takes roughly 4 hours to reach the Torres del Paine viewpoint from the start of Valle Ascencio, a pretty windy place to trek in Patagonian summer so make sure to bring a windproof jacket if you're there between October to March. It's also important to bear in mind that the last 45 minutes up to the look-out are a steep uphill climb over rocks and sandy terrain, and many hikers take trekking poles to help their knees on the way back down.

After trekking up to the look-out, hard-core climbers can continue up along Valle Silencio, past Campamento Japones and through dense rainforest for views of 'los Cuernos' mountains, Escudo (the Shield) and Fortaleza (the Fortress), as well as the back of the spectacular granite spires, Las Torres.

Name: Torres del Paine National Park Administration Centre
Description: The primary administrative headquarters for Torres del Paine National Park in Chilean Patagonia, managed by the National Forestry Corporation (CONAF). This main office and visitor center is located in the Lago Toro sector, about 145 km from Puerto Natales and 33 km from the park's main access gate (Sarmiento gate), providing essential services, information, and environmental education.
Description (with html): The primary administrative headquarters for Torres del Paine National Park in Chilean Patagonia, managed by the National Forestry Corporation (CONAF). This main office and visitor center is located in the Lago Toro sector, about 145 km from Puerto Natales and 33 km from the park's main access gate (Sarmiento gate), providing essential services, information, and environmental education.

Name: Trelew
Description: Found in the Chubut Province on the eastern coast of Argentinian Patagonia, Trelew is one of the Welsh cities in Argentina and has a large and recently refurbished airport servicing the region, with flights to Buenos Aires taking just under 2 hours. Trelew itself is a large industrial city processing wool and was founded in 1886 by Welsh settlers who also established many other towns and cities in the area such as Esquel, Gaiman and Rawson. There are some wonderful spots to visit not far from Trelew including the Peninsula Valdes, a wildlife haven for whales, penguins and seals, which was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1999. In order to reach Puerto Piramides, the only small town within the Peninsula, it's best to take the bus to Puerto Madryn (45 minutes) and from there to Puerto Piramides (30 minutes). Find out more about visiting Peninsula Valdes >>

Name: Tronador Volcano
Description: Tronador, 3,478m, is an extinct volcano on the border between Argentina and Chile, near Bariloche. It’s a popular mountaineering destination and in both the Nahuel Huapi National Park in Argentina and the Vicente Pérez Rosales National Park in Chile.
Description (with html): Tronador, 3,478m, is an extinct volcano on the border between Argentina and Chile, near Bariloche. It’s a popular mountaineering destination and in both the Nahuel Huapi National Park in Argentina and the Vicente Pérez Rosales National Park in Chile.

Name: Tucker Islets
Description: These small islands lie in the Magellan Straits and can be seen on an adventure cruise. Excursions on Zodiac boats take you up to the Tucker Islets to see the native Magellanic penguins.
Description (with html): These small islands lie in the Magellan Straits and can be seen on an adventure cruise. Excursions on Zodiac boats take you up to the Tucker Islets to see the native Magellanic penguins.

Name: Tyndall Glacier
Description: Tyndall Glacier or Geike Glacier is one of the largest glaciers in the Southern Patagonian Ice Field. It is located in the Torres del Paine National Park, Chile. The glacier has its main calving front in Geikie Lake and like its neighbor, Grey Glacier, it has been significantly retreating for the last years.
Description (with html): Tyndall Glacier or Geike Glacier is one of the largest glaciers in the Southern Patagonian Ice Field. It is located in the Torres del Paine National Park, Chile. The glacier has its main calving front in Geikie Lake and like its neighbor, Grey Glacier, it has been significantly retreating for the last years.

Name: Upsala Glacier
Description: About the Glacier Named after Uppsala University (spelt at the time with only one ' p '), in Sweden - the University sponsored some of the first glaciological exploration of the region Upsala is well known for its rapid retreat over recent decades and is commonly used as evidence of global warming Is even bigger than the more famous and accesible Perito Moreno Where is it? Upsala is a large valley glacier found in Argentina's Los Glaciares National Park ("The Glaciers" National Park) It flows from the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, which also feeds the famous Perito Moreno glacier The glacier's terminus is at the shore of Lago Argentino How to see it: Great for day visits, it can be combined with a tour of a nearby Patagonian estancia from which you can go for a guided hike or 4x4 adventure into the mountains to panoramic viewpoints. A popular destination for travellers, it is served by the hotels of El Chalten and the airport in El Calafate Incorporate it into a broader exploration of Los Glaciares and Patagonia More Details >>
Description (with html):
About the Glacier

  • Named after Uppsala University (spelt at the time with only one 'p'), in Sweden - the University sponsored some of the first glaciological exploration of the region
  • Upsala is well known for its rapid retreat over recent decades and is commonly used as evidence of global warming
  • Is even bigger than the more famous and accesible Perito Moreno

Where is it?

  • Upsala is a large valley glacier found in Argentina's Los Glaciares National Park ("The Glaciers" National Park)
  • It flows from the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, which also feeds the famous Perito Moreno glacier
  • The glacier's terminus is at the shore of Lago Argentino

How to see it:

  • Great for day visits, it can be combined with a tour of a nearby Patagonian estancia from which you can go for a guided hike or 4x4 adventure into the mountains to panoramic viewpoints.
  • A popular destination for travellers, it is served by the hotels of El Chalten and the airport in El Calafate
  • Incorporate it into a broader exploration of Los Glaciares and Patagonia

    More Details >>

Name: Ushuaia
Description: Ushuaia is the access town to the Beagle Channel and the great hiking and kayaking opportunities available in Tierra del Fuego. Many travellers stay here before going to see the island's many sea lion colonies and penguin rookeries, or hopping off on a 2 to 3 day kayaking trip around Gable Island in the Beagle Channel. Antarctic Port Ushuaia is even better known as the port from which most Antarctic cruises depart for Antarctic sea adventures of up to 20 days. The cruises first cross the Drake Passage before reaching the South Shetland Islands or they sail via South Georgia and Sandwich Islands. Instead of setting out from the port of Ushuaia, some cruises start off in the Falkland Islands, spending a day or two enjoying its markets, restaurants, flora and fauna, before heading towards the coast of Antarctica. Other ships instead offer a fly and cruise option, with flights from the Chilean town of Punta Arenas straight through to an Antarctic research base on King George Island. Accommodation This is the perfect place to stay before you set out on your adventures in Tierra del Fuego or Antarctica. Find hotels in Ushuaia, and check availability for your dates. If you're heading on to explore Torres del Paine, read our blog post to find out about getting to Punta Arenas from Ushuaia.

Name: Ushuaia Airport (USH)
Description: Ushuaia is the southernmost city in the world, and the access point for almost all trips to Tierra del Fuego, as well as Antarctic Cruises. Flights to/from El Calafate and Buenos Aires (AEP). You can cross from here to Chilean Tierra del Fuego with a boat trip across the Beagle Channel.

Name: Uyuni
Description: Uyuni is a city in southwest Bolivia. It's the most convenient place from which to access the Uyuni Salt Flats.There is an airport just outside the city which has flights to La Paz and Sucre.
Description (with html):
Uyuni is a city in southwest Bolivia. It's the most convenient place from which to access the Uyuni Salt Flats.

There is an airport just outside the city which has flights to La Paz and Sucre.

Name: Uyuni Lodge
Description: Uyuni Lodge is located on the northern edge of the Uyuni Salt Flats, not far from the small settlement of Jijira.
Description (with html): Uyuni Lodge is located on the northern edge of the Uyuni Salt Flats, not far from the small settlement of Jijira.

Name: Uyuni Salt Flats
Description: The Uyuni Salt Flats are the largest in the world. They sit at around 12,000ft/3,665m above sea level and cover a vast 3,900 miles²/10,000km².
Description (with html): The Uyuni Salt Flats are the largest in the world. They sit at around 12,000ft/3,665m above sea level and cover a vast 3,900 miles²/10,000km².

Name: Valle Bader
Description: The Bader Valley lies between the Cuernos and Las Torres, the dominant peaks of Torres del Paine National Park. The path up this valley is nothing like the main trails of the popular W Trek - it's more of a little track, and the park rangers don't let people head up here without a guide. The route is challenging in parts and not always clear, but once you clear the Nirre trees you're rewarded with fantastic views of the beautiful Lago Nordenskjold. There is a small camp at the top and a makeshift hut used by the climbers. You can carry on from here to the base of Cuerno Norte and a glacial lagoon. See our off-the-beaten track guide for more on the hidden valleys and passes of Torres del Paine.

Name: Valle Carbajal
Description: Valle Carbajal (Carbajal Valley) is a beautiful, U-shaped glacial valley in the Fuegian Andes of Tierra del Fuego, Argentina, near the city of Ushuaia, which is famous for its picturesque peat bogs and as a popular destination for hiking, trekking, and winter sports.
Description (with html): Valle Carbajal (Carbajal Valley) is a beautiful, U-shaped glacial valley in the Fuegian Andes of Tierra del Fuego, Argentina, near the city of Ushuaia, which is famous for its picturesque peat bogs and as a popular destination for hiking, trekking, and winter sports.

Name: Valle Chacabuco
Description: Valle Chacabuco provides an incredible landscape - a rare east-west valley, it showcases the transition from Andean peaks through to the grasslands of the steppe. Valle Chacabuco is at the heart of the planned "Patagonia National Park". The park has been under development since 2004 and is this year (2014) opening to the public (although not yet a "National" Park).

Name: Valle de Andorra
Description: Andorra Valley is one of the hikes popular in Tierra del Fuego, especially for people based in the southernmost city in the world, Ushuaia. Here you'll see a fantastic mountain range and also have views out over Ushuaia and the Beagle Channel beyond. Find out more about discovering Tierra del Fuego .

↵

Name: Valle del Silencio
Description: A hard 4 and a half hour slog up from the Torres del Paine look-out point, Valle del Silencio is really only for climbers with an appetite for a tough challenge. We’ve only come across a handful of operators that will take you to Valle Silencio and Valle Bader (in between Valle Ascencio and Valle Frances), and you do need a guide for these.
Description (with html): A hard 4 and a half hour slog up from the Torres del Paine look-out point, Valle del Silencio is really only for climbers with an appetite for a tough challenge. We’ve only come across a handful of operators that will take you to Valle Silencio and Valle Bader (in between Valle Ascencio and Valle Frances), and you do need a guide for these.

Name: Valle Frances
Description: Where to find it Torres del Paine National Park, Chile What is it? Valle Frances (the French Valley) is a deep valley between mountains in Torres del Paine and is one of the main hiking attractions in the national park. It is dominated by a magnificent hanging glacier, Glaciar Frances, beech forests and the French River.It takes roughly two hours to trek into the valley before you get your first glimpse of the glacier and you can hear the rumble of small avalanches in the distance and watch ice calving from its face. How can I see it? You will hike the French Valley on Torres del Paine's two most famous multi-day hikes, the Full Circuit and the W Trek. It's also possible to do it as a day hike as part of a series of day trips in Torres del Paine, returning to a comfortable base each night.On the Full Circuit you typically approach the French Valley from the east, starting from the nearest refugio, Paine Grande. On the W Trek you'd most likely start from the west, trekking from nearby Refugio los Cuernos. The weather is famously temperamental here, and a thick mist can descend making it impossible to reach the end of the valley. However if you do make it up to the end of the valley, expect spectacular views of Cerro Cota (2000m) and Cerro Catedral (2200m), a mountain which is said to resemble a cathedral facade. Find out more about... The W Trek The Full Circuit Hiking in Torres del Paine
Description (with html):
Where to find it

Torres del Paine National Park, Chile

What is it?

Valle Frances (the French Valley) is a deep valley between mountains in Torres del Paine and is one of the main hiking attractions in the national park. It is dominated by a magnificent hanging glacier, Glaciar Frances, beech forests and the French River.

It takes roughly two hours to trek into the valley before you get your first glimpse of the glacier and you can hear the rumble of small avalanches in the distance and watch ice calving from its face.

How can I see it?

You will hike the French Valley on Torres del Paine's two most famous multi-day hikes, the Full Circuit and the W Trek. It's also possible to do it as a day hike as part of a series of day trips in Torres del Paine, returning to a comfortable base each night.

On the Full Circuit you typically approach the French Valley from the east, starting from the nearest refugio, Paine Grande. On the W Trek you'd most likely start from the west, trekking from nearby Refugio los Cuernos. The weather is famously temperamental here, and a thick mist can descend making it impossible to reach the end of the valley. However if you do make it up to the end of the valley, expect spectacular views of Cerro Cota (2000m) and Cerro Catedral (2200m), a mountain which is said to resemble a cathedral facade.

Find out more about... 

  • The W Trek
  • The Full Circuit
  • Hiking in Torres del Paine

Name: Valle Pingo
Description: The Pingo Valley lies to the west of Lago Grey in Torres del Paine National Park and is visited by very few people, which is wonderful for the Huemul deer and the few people who get out there. The initial trek into the valley is pretty easy going and well marked, and you'll come across a couple of impressive waterfalls. The first section is through an open valley and then you'll pass through a lenga forest. Once established in the valley, you can explore the Pingo Glacier and the Zapata Glacier (which lies right on the edge of the Ice Cap) from a basecamp in the valley. However, a guide is definitely needed. Tom was trekking out here in 2017 and didn't see a soul the whole time he was. Beware of the wild baguales and the mosquitos!

Name: Valle Pollone
Description: This boulder-filled valley is a dramatic place to trek and there are stunning views from here, including Mount Fitz Roy and the Marconi Glacier. Trekking into this valley requires a guide and it is much tougher than the main hiking trail along the neighbouring Rio Electrico Valley, but the experience is well worth the effort.

Name: Valle Superior
Description: Valle Superior on Montes Martial trek route, Tierra del Fuego national park.
Description (with html): Valle Superior on Montes Martial trek route, Tierra del Fuego national park.

Name: Valle Tierra Mayor
Description: Tierra Mayor Valley is a beautiful place to trek in Argentinian Tierra del Fuego. At the start of the valley you have spectacular views of the mountain ranges surrounding you, which are usually covered in snow. People usually trek there on their way up the Paso 5 Hermanos or 'Pass of the 5 Brothers'. Find out more about trekking in Tierra del Fuego or visiting the nearest city, Ushuaia, the last point before Antarctica.
