At the start of the valley you have spectacular views of the mountain ranges surrounding you, which are usually covered in snow. People usually trek there on their way up the Paso 5 Hermanos or 'Pass of the 5 Brothers'.

↵

Find out more about trekking in Tierra del Fuego or visiting the nearest city, Ushuaia, the last point before Antarctica.

Name: Valparaiso
Description: Chile's lively, bustling historic port city is famous for its eclectic mix of UNESCO protected architecture, its multi-coloured houses, turn of the century funiculars that still transport people up to the surrounding hills, world-class street art and delicious fresh seafood. Visit the house of the Noble Prize winner Pablo Neruda or spend a day visiting the vineyards of the near by Casablanca Valley.
Description (with html): Chile's lively, bustling historic port city is famous for its eclectic mix of UNESCO protected architecture, its multi-coloured houses, turn of the century funiculars that still transport people up to the surrounding hills, world-class street art and delicious fresh seafood. Visit the house of the Noble Prize winner Pablo Neruda or spend a day visiting the vineyards of the near by Casablanca Valley.

Name: Ventisquero Chico
Description: Also known as Glaciar Chico, this glacier feeds into Lago Chico, which in turn runs into the southern branch of Lago O'Higgins.
Description (with html): Also known as Glaciar Chico, this glacier feeds into Lago Chico, which in turn runs into the southern branch of Lago O'Higgins.

Name: Ventisquero Colgante Waterfall
Description: The Ventisquero Colgante Waterfall (Hanging Glacier Waterfall) is a spectacular and massive waterfall in Queulat National Park in Chilean Patagonia. It is a stunning natural wonder formed by a huge hanging glacier melting and plunging thousands of feet down a cliff face, creating a dramatic and powerful waterfall.
Description (with html): The Ventisquero Colgante Waterfall (Hanging Glacier Waterfall) is a spectacular and massive waterfall in Queulat National Park in Chilean Patagonia. It is a stunning natural wonder formed by a huge hanging glacier melting and plunging thousands of feet down a cliff face, creating a dramatic and powerful waterfall.

Name: Vicuña
Description: Vicuña is both a city in the Elqui Valley of northern Chile and a wild camelid native to the high-altitude Andes Mountains of South America. The city of Vicuña is famous for its clear skies, making it a world-renowned center for astrotourism and a major producer of Chilean pisco, while the animal, the vicuña, is prized for its exceptionally fine and valuable wool.
Description (with html): Vicuña is both a city in the Elqui Valley of northern Chile and a wild camelid native to the high-altitude Andes Mountains of South America. The city of Vicuña is famous for its clear skies, making it a world-renowned center for astrotourism and a major producer of Chilean pisco, while the animal, the vicuña, is prized for its exceptionally fine and valuable wool.

Name: Villa Catedral
Description: Patagonia's most famous ski resort, just 19km from Bariloche Villa Catedral is inside the Nahuel Huapi National Park in the Argentinian Lake District. As well as skiing, you can also set out from here on a 4 day hut-to-hut hike through the nearby mountains in the heart of Nahuel Huapi National Park.
Description (with html): Patagonia's most famous ski resort, just 19km from Bariloche Villa Catedral is inside the Nahuel Huapi National Park in the Argentinian Lake District. As well as skiing, you can also set out from here on a 4 day hut-to-hut hike through the nearby mountains in the heart of Nahuel Huapi National Park.

Name: Villa Cerro Castillo
Description: Villa Cerro Castillo is a small farming town located in the Aysén region of Chile. It's used as a base for treks into the Cerro Castillo National Reserve.
Description (with html): Villa Cerro Castillo is a small farming town located in the Aysén region of Chile. It's used as a base for treks into the Cerro Castillo National Reserve.

Name: Villa Cerro Castillo (Aysen)
Description: A small town founded in 1966, located in the Aysen region in the southern part of Chile.
Description (with html): A small town founded in 1966, located in the Aysen region in the southern part of Chile.

Name: Villa La Angostura
Description: The small upmarket resort town of Villa La Angostura sits on the northern finger of Lake Nahuel Huapi in Argentina's Lake District. It's a very picturesque place full of wooden alpine architecture, and offers a glimpse of what Bariloche used to look like before it began to grow (and has almost as many high end chocolate shops. The town has some excellent restaurants and a well-run tourist office. The town attracts local tourists year-round. In the winter, nearby Cerro Bayo is a boutique-sized ski and snowboarding resort. In the summer there are plenty of hiking opportunities, including to the waterfall of Cascada Río Bonito and through the woods to the blue waters of Laguna Verde . A particular highlight is the pocket-sized Arrayanes National Park on the Quetrihue Peninsula. The park is a half-day 12km hike from the town, but it's a popular activity to hire bikes for the trip along the well-marked trail. Locals like to recount the (sadly apocryphal) story that rust red bark of the arrayán trees here were the original inspiration for the forest in the Disney film Bambi . Villa La Angostura is 83km north of Bariloche, a 75-minute drive along RN40. The same road continues north to San Martín de los Andes, a further two hours and 108km away, following the tremendously scenic Route of the Seven Lakes (Rua de los Siete Lagos)
Description (with html):
The small upmarket resort town of Villa La Angostura sits on the northern finger of Lake Nahuel Huapi in Argentina's Lake District. It's a very picturesque place full of wooden alpine architecture, and offers a glimpse of what Bariloche used to look like before it began to grow (and has almost as many high end chocolate shops. The town has some excellent restaurants and a well-run tourist office. 

The town attracts local tourists year-round. In the winter, nearby Cerro Bayo is a boutique-sized ski and snowboarding resort. In the summer there are plenty of hiking opportunities, including to the waterfall of Cascada Río Bonito and through the woods to the blue waters of Laguna Verde. A particular highlight is the pocket-sized Arrayanes National Park on the Quetrihue Peninsula. The park is a half-day 12km hike from the town, but it's a popular activity to hire bikes for the trip along the well-marked trail. Locals like to recount the (sadly apocryphal) story that rust red bark of the arrayán trees here were the original inspiration for the forest in the Disney film Bambi. 

Villa La Angostura is 83km north of Bariloche, a 75-minute drive along RN40. The same road continues north to San Martín de los Andes, a further two hours and 108km away, following the tremendously scenic Route of the Seven Lakes (Rua de los Siete Lagos)

Name: Villa O'Higgins
Description: Villa O'Higgins is a Chilean town at the Southern end of the Carretera Austral. It's actually only about 60 miles North of El Chalten. The town, the lake that it sits on, and the National Park that stretches all the way down to Torres del Paine is named after the Chilean Independence leader Bernardo o Higgins.
Description (with html): Villa O'Higgins is a Chilean town at the Southern end of the Carretera Austral. It's actually only about 60 miles North of El Chalten. The town, the lake that it sits on, and the National Park that stretches all the way down to Torres del Paine is named after the Chilean Independence leader Bernardo o Higgins.

Name: Villa Traful
Description: Villa Traful is a hamlet on the shore of Lake Traful. It is located in the Nahuel Huapi National Park on the Road of the Seven lakes, 60km from Villa La Angostura and 100km from Bariloche. It consists of about 80 houses, built in traditional Alpine-Andine architecture that combines wood with stone.
Description (with html): Villa Traful is a hamlet on the shore of Lake Traful. It is located in the Nahuel Huapi National Park on the Road of the Seven lakes, 60km from Villa La Angostura and 100km from Bariloche. It consists of about 80 houses, built in traditional Alpine-Andine architecture that combines wood with stone.

Name: Villarino Beach
Description: Villarino Beach is located in the San José Gulf on Pensinsula Valdes. It is the end point of our three-day kayaking trip.
Description (with html): Villarino Beach is located in the San José Gulf on Pensinsula Valdes. It is the end point of our three-day kayaking trip.

Name: Villarrica Volcano
Description: Chile's most active volcano, Villarrica is a cauldron of bubbling lava and venting steam that's erupted dozens of times, including a major 1971 event that expelled 30 million cubic meters of lava in a flow that spread over 14 kilometres. Rising above the lake and town of the same name, Volcan Villarrica is climbed relatively often, with guided expeditions from nearby Pucon. In the winter, there is a ski resort on the northern slopes of the volcano.
Description (with html):
Chile's most active volcano, Villarrica is a cauldron of bubbling lava and venting steam that's erupted dozens of times, including a major 1971 event that expelled 30 million cubic meters of lava in a flow that spread over 14 kilometres.

↵

Name: Viña del Mar
Description: The sophisticated Viña del Mar is possibly the country's most revered seaside resort. Filled with lush parks, beautiful avenues and an attractive promenade. It's popular with both Chileans and foreigners during the summer months from December to February.
Description (with html): The sophisticated Viña del Mar is possibly the country's most revered seaside resort. Filled with lush parks, beautiful avenues and an attractive promenade. It's popular with both Chileans and foreigners during the summer months from December to February.

Name: Vincente Pérez Rosales National Park
Description: Vincente Pérez Rosales National Park is located in Los Lagos region of Llanquihue in Chile. The park covers 2,530 square km and its western entrance is near Ensenada.
Description (with html): Vincente Pérez Rosales National Park is located in Los Lagos region of Llanquihue in Chile. The park covers 2,530 square km and its western entrance is near Ensenada.

Name: Volcan Hudson
Description: Also known as Mount Hudson, this is the site of one of the 20th Century's largest eruptions in 1991. Some activity was detected in 2011 and the Chilean government was quick to put in place safety precautions and evacuate the surrounding areas.
Description (with html): Also known as Mount Hudson, this is the site of one of the 20th Century's largest eruptions in 1991. Some activity was detected in 2011 and the Chilean government was quick to put in place safety precautions and evacuate the surrounding areas.

Name: Volcan Lanin
Description: Volcan Lanin , 3,776m, can be tackled in 2 days, plus 2 days of travel to/from (nearest town is San Martin de Los Andes). On the first day you will practice some of the skills you'll be using on Day 2, summit day. Lanin sits on the Chilean-Argentinian border and offers fantastic views across the Andes the Chilean volcanoes. You can tackle Lanin between December and April (or possibly July-October as part of a ski touring trip). Contact us to find out about tours and guides for your dates.

Name: Volcan Lanin Mountain Camp
Description: Mountain camp at 2400m. Sleep here and make preparations for the trek to the summit of Lanín Volcano.
Description (with html): Mountain camp at 2400m. Sleep here and make preparations for the trek to the summit of Lanín Volcano.

Name: Volcán Lonquimay
Description: The reserve's focal point. Slightly northeast of town, it dates from the late Pleistocene but erupted as recently as 1933, almost simultaneously with nearby Volcan Llaima, and lava flows spilled down its northestern flanks in 1990. Trails to nearby Cerro Cautin (2.5 hours) and Lonquimay's summit start here, and Sendero de Chile rounds Lonquimay before decending into town and then continuing toward the Sierra Nevada and Conguillo; a new trekking map, for sale at La Suizandina will make hiking here easier. 2,865 m (9,400 ft)
Description (with html):

Name: Volcan Osorno
Description: A stunning snow-capped volcano that lies on the southeastern shore of the huge Llanquihue Lake, one-two hours from the Chilean town of Puerto Varas, and near to the popular Petrohue waterfalls. This active volcano stands at 2,652 metres above sea level. There's a wonderful 4-7 hour hike around the volcano for those wanting a 360 perspective on the volcano and its surrounding lakes, and for the more adventurous you can hike up to the summit of the volcano. Be prepared for a very early start, dawn ascent and crampons and ice axe for the final push to the summit. Find out more about Technical Volcano Hikes >>
Description (with html):
A stunning snow-capped volcano that lies on the southeastern shore of the huge Llanquihue Lake, one-two hours from the Chilean town of Puerto Varas, and near to the popular Petrohue waterfalls.

Name: Volcan Quetrupillán
Description: A 2,360 metre volcano in the Villarica national park. You can ski this volcano in the winter months.
Description (with html): A 2,360 metre volcano in the Villarica national park. You can ski this volcano in the winter months.

Name: Weber Bridge
Description: The Weber Bridge is located at the north of Lake Toro in Torres del Paine. It is the end point of the 14km Lazo-Weber Trail.
Description (with html): The Weber Bridge is located at the north of Lake Toro in Torres del Paine. It is the end point of the 14km Lazo-Weber Trail.

Name: Wulaia Bay
Description: This fascinating bay is one of the spots visited on an adventure cruise from Ushuaia to Punta Arenas, and vice versa. This cruise is the only way to get here, so it's a beautifully quiet and peaceful place. Not only is it a picturesque spot that looks out over the Beagle Channel, but Wulaia is also an archaeological site with remains from the early settlement of the Yaghan peoples. Find out more about visiting Wulaia Bay on board a Patagonian Adventure Cruise.
Description (with html):

This cruise is the only way to get here, so it's a beautifully quiet and peaceful place. ↵

Find out more about visiting Wulaia Bay on board a Patagonian Adventure Cruise.

Name: Yelcho en la Patagonia
Description: Situated on Lago Yelcho, accommodation is available in a hotel with 8 bedrooms, 6 cabins and a covered campsite. From here you have access to the famous fly fishing on Lago Yelcho, as well as other activities and excursions in the area.
Description (with html): Situated on Lago Yelcho, accommodation is available in a hotel with 8 bedrooms, 6 cabins and a covered campsite. From here you have access to the famous fly fishing on Lago Yelcho, as well as other activities and excursions in the area.
NEW CUSTOM ADDRESS/WHAT3WORDS: Lago Yelcho, Puerto Cardenas, Chile

Name: Zapata camp
Description: Zapata camp is located in Torres del Paine National Park. It is a basic campsite, used as a base from which to explore the Ichthyosaurus graveyard and to climb the summit of Cerro Zapata.
Description (with html): Zapata camp is located in Torres del Paine National Park. It is a basic campsite, used as a base from which to explore the Ichthyosaurus graveyard and to climb the summit of Cerro Zapata.

Name: Zapata Valley
Description: The Zapata Valley is located in Torres del Paine National Park and can be entered from Lake Grey. Few trekkers visit this valley.
Description (with html): The Zapata Valley is located in Torres del Paine National Park and can be entered from Lake Grey. Few trekkers visit this valley.

Name: Laguna Cóndor
Description: Laguna Cóndor is a small lagoon located in the Los Glaciares region of Argentina. It is fed by the Río Cañadon de los Toros and sits at an altitude of 450m.
Description (with html): Laguna Cóndor is a small lagoon located in the Los Glaciares region of Argentina. It is fed by the Río Cañadon de los Toros and sits at an altitude of 450m.

Name: Madsen House
Description: This is the house of pioneer Andreas Madsen. On a visit here, you will learn about the history of the Madsen family and the challenges faced by them during their everyday life in this estancia over a century ago.
Description (with html): This is the house of pioneer Andreas Madsen. On a visit here, you will learn about the history of the Madsen family and the challenges faced by them during their everyday life in this estancia over a century ago.

Name: La Leona Petrified Forest
Description: The La Leona Petrified Forest is located on the bank of Río La Leona in the Los Glaciares region of Argentina.
Description (with html): The La Leona Petrified Forest is located on the bank of Río La Leona in the Los Glaciares region of Argentina.

Name: Río La Leona
Description: The Río La Leona flows through the eastern part of the Los Glaciares National Park. It starts at the southeastern part of Lago Viedma and finishes at Lago Argentino, about 50km (31 miles) away.
Description (with html): The Río La Leona flows through the eastern part of the Los Glaciares National Park. It starts at the southeastern part of Lago Viedma and finishes at Lago Argentino, about 50km (31 miles) away.

Name: Laguna Los Tempanos
Description: Laguna Los Tempanos, or Iceberg Bay in English, is located on the northwestern side of Lago Viedma in Los Glaciares. There is a campsite here for trekkers who are following the Huemul Circuit.
Description (with html): Laguna Los Tempanos, or Iceberg Bay in English, is located on the northwestern side of Lago Viedma in Los Glaciares. There is a campsite here for trekkers who are following the Huemul Circuit.

Name: Lago Argentino
Description: Lago Argentino is located in the Los Glaciares National Park, Patagonia, Argentina. It is the largest freshwater lake in Argentina, covering 1,415km². Its northwestern arm leads to Upsala Glacier, while the south-southwestern arm ends at Perito Moreno Glacier.
Description (with html): Lago Argentino is located in the Los Glaciares National Park, Patagonia, Argentina. It is the largest freshwater lake in Argentina, covering 1,415km². Its northwestern arm leads to Upsala Glacier, while the south-southwestern arm ends at Perito Moreno Glacier.

Name: Laguna Nimez
Description: Laguna Nimez is located on the north side of El Calafate town in Patagonia, Argentina. It is home to many indigenous birds, such as Chilean flamingos, Andean ruddy ducks and Magellanic plovers, with over 130 recorded species being sighted.
Description (with html): Laguna Nimez is located on the north side of El Calafate town in Patagonia, Argentina. It is home to many indigenous birds, such as Chilean flamingos, Andean ruddy ducks and Magellanic plovers, with over 130 recorded species being sighted.

Name: Thorwood Comfort Camp
Description: Nestled slightly away from the crowds of trekkers heading to Laguna Torre, this basic yet protected camping area is reserved for authorised park outfitters only. Here you'll find simple base-camp tents for communal use at meal times, and smaller tents for trekkers to retire to for the night. Basic drop toilets are available.
Description (with html): Nestled slightly away from the crowds of trekkers heading to Laguna Torre, this basic yet protected camping area is reserved for authorised park outfitters only. Here you'll find simple base-camp tents for communal use at meal times, and smaller tents for trekkers to retire to for the night. Basic drop toilets are available.

Name: Refugio Soto
Description: Refugio Eduardo García Soto is a mountain hut located within Bernardo O'Higgins National Park in the Aysén region of Chile. It sits at an elevation of 1,600m and is a key point on several trekking routes in the area. The hut is a basic structure with no faciltiies. It will be visited on a trek to Cerro Gorra Blanca.
Description (with html): Refugio Eduardo García Soto is a mountain hut located within Bernardo O'Higgins National Park in the Aysén region of Chile. It sits at an elevation of 1,600m and is a key point on several trekking routes in the area. The hut is a basic structure with no faciltiies. It will be visited on a trek to Cerro Gorra Blanca.

Name: Karukinka Natural Park
Description: Karukinka Natural Park is a private natural park, established in 2004 and located on the Chilean part of the Isla Grande de Tierra del Fuego. The land for the park was donated to the Wildlife Conservation Society by Goldman Sachs.
Description (with html): Karukinka Natural Park is a private natural park, established in 2004 and located on the Chilean part of the Isla Grande de Tierra del Fuego. The land for the park was donated to the Wildlife Conservation Society by Goldman Sachs.

Name: Isla de Los Estados
Description: Isla de los Estados is an island in Argentina, located 29 kilometres (18 miles) to the east of Tierra del Fuego, from which it is separated by the Le Maire Strait. The island is part of the Argentine province of Tierra del Fuego and has been awarded the status of an 'Ecological, Historic, and Tourist Provincial Reserve'.
Description (with html): Isla de los Estados is an island in Argentina, located 29 kilometres (18 miles) to the east of Tierra del Fuego, from which it is separated by the Le Maire Strait. The island is part of the Argentine province of Tierra del Fuego and has been awarded the status of an 'Ecological, Historic, and Tourist Provincial Reserve'.
